As a result, purchasing materials at this time will enable her to save money for the upcoming White Moon festival (a traditional Mongolian ceremony). Most importantly, the renovated house will have the benefit of not losing heat so easily, contributing to the efforts against air pollution by enabling the family to burn less coal.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials such as paints, gypsum and bricks

loans.name: Aferdita

texts.en:
Aferdita, twenty-six years old, lives in a minority community in very bad conditions. She is married and the mother of four children between the ages of eight and fifteen years old. All of them are currently attending school. Her husband works by carrying wood by tractor, earning a small income from this business for their family. 

Aferdita is now planning to raise and tend to goats, so that she may start to sell milk and other milk products. She is in need of a 600 euro loan to buy seven goats. 

The loan will help her to expand and develop her business, and she hopes that these goats will breed, multiplying her numbers to seventeen goats in just a few months. 

Her goal is to sell milk and milk products, as well as to breed and sell the goats. In this way, she can improve the living conditions for her family and provide a better quality of life and opportunities for her children. She wants to thank all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy seven goats.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
This is Rebecca, 55, a resident of Dasmariñas, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Carlos, a driver, and she is a mother to her children. She and her husband are managing their household while operating the business. They are working hand in hand to provide income for their everyday expenses.

Rebecca owns and oversees operations of their jeepney (see footnote) transportation business. She has one unit (14-16 person capacity) jeepney, which is paying boundary (daily quota) each day. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of Php 1,000 every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php20,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy spare parts and for the maintenance of her jeepney unit. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.

Rebecca dreams to have a happy family and hopes that her grandchildren will finish their studies. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her life and business every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

-Jeepneys are the most popular means of public transportation in the Philippines. They were originally made from US military jeeps left over from World War II and are known from their flamboyant decoration and crowded seating. Filipino ingenuity, however, managed to see this vehicle as an opportunity to earn, and modified the Jeep into a 20-seater jeepney, open enough to provide adequate ventilation, sturdy for every day travel, and cheap enough to buy and maintain. They have become a ubiquitous symbol of Philippine culture. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for the spare parts and maintenance of their jeepney unit.

loans.name: Scolastica

texts.en:
Scolastica is married and has five children who are all in school. Her business is selling household products. She started this business in order to provide for her family. It is her only source of income. Scolastica is requesting a loan to buy more products so that she can increase her business. She will buy soda, bread, snacks, beans, rice and other goods which her customers frequently request. This will represent a substantial improvement to her business as she will have a wider range of products available and will thereby be able to improve her income.

Scolastica's future goal is to expand her store into a wholesale business. She also aims to make her business profitable so that she can meet the needs of her household.

loans.use: to buy soda, bread, snacks, beans, rice and other goods which her customers frequently request.

loans.name: Siony

texts.en: Siony, 39 years old, is married, and they were blessed with four children. She has been into vegetable farming for almost two years, and when they harvest some vegetables she earns a net income of about Php 2,000. She wants a loan amounting to Php 17,000 to purchase fertilizers for vegetable farming. On her farm they plant a variety of vegetables such as eggplants, tomatoes, string beans, and squash. She's hoping that her requested loan will be granted so that she can improve her business.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers for vegetable farming

loans.name: Spiro

texts.en:
Spiro wants to thank all of the lenders who helped him buy what he needed for his hardware store with the previous loan.
Now he is requesting a second loan for a larger amount, and the goal would be almost the same as previous one: to purchase materials and tools useful to the construction industry.

loans.use: To stock up on construction materials for his hardware store

loans.name: Luvuno

texts.en:
Luvuno is a married woman with two children. She operates a fish selling business in Kwale, Kenya. She started this business one year ago from her savings. She sells her fish from home. Her other source of income includes farming.

She is requesting a loan to be able to boost her income and improve her living conditions. Her future goals are to become the leading fish supplier in the region by expanding her business and providing jobs to other people through hiring them, so as to improve their living standards also. Luvuno will use this money to purchase more fish to sell and to pay for transporting the fish.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell and to pay for transporting the fish.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy clothes for her clothes selling business.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy thread and cloth for her prayer sheet making business.

loans.name: Gulnoza

texts.en:
Gulnoza is a very kind and smart girl. She is 20 years old. She is single and lives with her parents. She and her family live in a village and they are happy with their living conditions. Her parents do not have higher education degrees and they have always dreamed of giving their children a higher education so they can become good specialists in the future. 

After graduation, Gulnoza entered the Ozody University of Tajikistan. She is a third year student and studies very well. She dreams of being a good specialist in the future. She is asking for a loan to pay her tuition. She awaits your support.

loans.use: To pay for her tuition.

loans.name: Everline

texts.en:
Everline is a 28-year-old married woman. She has 3 children with ages ranging from 7 to 12 years. She describes herself as a hardworking woman. She operates a retail store where she sells various items such as cooking fat, detergents, margarine, flour, sugar, rice, etc. Her business is located in a viable business area and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds for improving the business. Everline also gets business income from her husband's grocery store which he operates.

She will use the Kes 21,000 loan to buy a water harvesting tank which will be used by her family members for household activities. Her business goal is to expand her business within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will improve her business. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM. She expects to finish installing her water tank after the delivery.

loans.use: to buy a water harvesting tank.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is a 36-year-old farmer, and she is married to Nelson, a businessman. They are blessed with four children. She has been practicing dairy farming for the past ten years with a monthly income of about KES 10,000 which she uses to sustain her family.

She is applying for her first loan term with KADET LTD. She will use the loan to buy animal feeds and to build a cow shed for her cattle. With the anticipated profits from the business she will improve the living standards of her family.

loans.use: To buy animal feeds and to build a cow shed for her cattle.

loans.name: Maria Catalina

texts.es: María Catalina, tiene 46 años de edad, es madre soltera, tiene tres hijos, vive con ellos en una aldea que pertenece a Intibucá. María lleva diez años de dedicarse a la elaboración y venta de tamales de pollo y de cerdo, y venta de cuajada de leche. Además vende comida cuando le solicitan. El negocio lo tiene establecido en un local del mercado local donde ya tiene sus clientes fijos. Ella vende todos los días. Actualmente esta solicitando el segundo préstamo a ODEF, por 8,000 Lempiras, para comprar los insumos necesarios para la elaboración de tamales y cuajada. Esta inversión le permitirá tener siempre materiales para elaborar su producto y siempre vender. Su meta es obtener mayor venta para poderle costear los estudios a sus hijos.
texts.en:
María Catalina, age 46, is a single mother and has three children.  She lives with them in a village in Intibucá.  María has been making and selling chicken and pork tamales as well as curdled milk for ten years.  She also sells food when it is requested of her.

She has established the business at a place in the local market, and she now has fixed customers.  She sells every day.

She is currently requesting a second loan from ODEF for 8,000 lempiras.  She will use the loan to buy the needed supplies to make the tamales and curdled milk.  This investment will allow her to always have materials to make her products and to always sell them.

Her goal is to have greater sales in order to be able to pay for her children’s education.

loans.use: to buy ingredients (milk, corn flour, meat, potatoes, rice, banana leaves, and condiments, etc.) to make tamales and curds.

loans.name: Jose Santos

texts.es: Jose, tiene 20 años de edad, es casado, tiene un hijo y vive en el municipio de Esparta Atlántida, con su esposa e hijo. José anteriormente trabajaba con la ganadería pero en busca de obtener mas ingresos decidió con su esposa establecer su propio negocio de pulpería, vende productos básicos como harina, azúcar, manteca, jabón, café, sal, arroz, pastillas, condimentos y otros abarrotes. para incrementar el inventario a decidido solicitar un préstamo por 8,000 Lempiras para comprar productos alimenticios y surtir la pulpería. El quiere que su negocio crezca y obtener mejores ganancias para su bienestar familiar y personal.
texts.en:
Jose, age 20, is married and has one child.  He lives with his wife and child in the Esparta Atlántida municipality.  José previously worked with livestock.  However, in the search to get more income, he decided to establish, with his wife, his own grocery store business.

He sells basic products like flour, sugar, shortening, soap, coffee, salt, rice, over the counter pills, condiments, and other groceries.  In order to increase his inventory he decided to request a loan for 8,000 lempiras.  He will use the loan to buy food products to stock his grocery store.  He wants his business to grow and to get better income for his personal well-being and that of his family.

loans.use: to buy food products like sugar, rice, shortening, meat, beans, and others to stock his grocery store.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy grocery items for her husband's grocery store

loans.name: Melodina

texts.en:
Melodina is a single woman from Talibon, Bohol. She is engaged in a retail store business. She sells biscuits, soaps, soft drinks and canned goods. She has been in this business for 2 years. 

She requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to buy feeds for her pigs, and she will also purchase rice, sugar and beverages in bulk to cater to the needs of her customers. In the future, Melodina would like to expand her business to alleviate her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar and beverages and feeds for the pigs.

loans.name: Juliah

texts.en:
Juliah is a married woman. She has 3 children. She describes herself to be a hardworking businesswoman. She operates a retail tailoring store where she sells clothes she makes as well as uniforms and fabric. She has been involved in this business for 5 years. Her business is located at a potential business area and her primary customers are students and the general public. She describes her biggest business challenge to be competition within the area. 

She will use the Kes 21,000 loan to buy a water harvesting tank which will be used by her family members on household activities. Her business goal is to expand her business within 5 years. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy a water tank.

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.ru:
Ахмад  мужчина пожилого возраста.  Он женат и имеет детей.  Всю свою жизнь Ахмад занимается разведением скота, так как в свое время не учился и не получил образования.  Но этот этот бизнес ему очень нравиться и он имеет хороший доход.  У него двое сыновей но по некоторым причинам они   уехали в Российскою Федерацию на заработки и там работают и по возможности присылают родителям денежные средства.  В прошлом году была засуха и Ахмад был вынужден покупать корм для скота по высокой цене. Теперь он хочет купить несколько голов скота и увеличить поголовье.  Хотя Ахмад в возрасте он сам занимается куплей продажей скота, сам выводит их на рынок и продает.   Ахмад не может сидеть без дела, он все время в движении и рад, что у него есть любимая работа. 
На полученный кредит Ахмад планирует купить скот и корм для скота. Он хочет до весны откормить скот и продать по выгодной цене так как к весне скот подорожает. Ахмад благодарить организацию Арванд за финансовую поддержку и помощь.
texts.en:
Ahmad is an elderly man. He is married and has children. All his life, Ahmad has been raising livestock, as in his youth he did not attend school and thus did not receive any education. However, he loves his business and earns a good living from it. Two of Ahmad's sons have gone to Russia to find jobs and now send their parents some money whenever possible.

Last year, there was a drought and Ahmad was forced to buy animal fodder at high prices. Now, he would like to buy several cows and thus increase the size of his herd. Despite his age, Ahmad runs his business on his own and personally takes his cattle to the market to sell it. He is unable to sit still, is always doing something, and is glad to be occupied with his favourite work. Ahmad is planning to use this loan to buy cattle and animal feed. He will fatten the animals and then sell them in the spring, when livestock prices go up. Ahmad thanks MDO Arvand for their financial support and help.

loans.use: to buy cattle

loans.name: Dimas Manuel

texts.es: Dimas  de 39 años de edad vive con su cónyuge y sus 4 hijos en las edades de 4 a 18 años en el suroccidente de la ciudad, donde tiene un negocio mediante el cual ofrece servicios de internet, llamadas a celulares y servicios de juegos electrónicos, de lunes a domingos, desde las 8 de la mañana hasta las 10 de la noche. Su experiencia data de hace 8 años cuando inició para obedecer las carencias del sector en el tema de comunicaciones modernas y de diversión sana en jóvenes y adolescentes. Su negocio ha progresado y hoy cuenta con 2 locales dedicados a esta actividad, donde trabajan él y su esposa y todos los ingresos familiares dependen de ella. Dimas  ha recibido 7 financiamientos de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual ha logrado su crecimiento empresarial y por eso se ha fijado metas de crecimientos, pues su sueño es que sus hijos lleguen a ser profesionales exitosos y  él y su esposa se esmeran trabajando persistentemente con el fin de lograrlo. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, con el cual comprará 3 computadores y accesorios, porque la demanda  de servicios se ha incrementado y su oferta no puede ser inferior para continuar sosteniendo su negocio y aumentando su posicionamiento en el barrio donde está ubicado.
texts.en:
Dimas is 39 years old and lives with his wife and his four children who are between the ages of 4 and 18 years old. They live in the south west of their city, where he has a business through which he offers internet services, mobile telephone calls and electronic games services. He works 7 days a week from 8 am till 10 pm. His experience started 8 years ago when he started to notice a gap in the market for modern communications and healthy entertainment for young people and teenagers. His business has grown and today he has two premises where he and his wife work and the family income depends on the business.

Dimas has received 7 loans from the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, through which he has been able to expand his business. This is why he has set himself growth targets, as his dream is that his sons will be successful professionals and Dimas and his wife work extremely hard in order to achieve this dream. He is now applying for a Kiva loan, which he will use to buy 3 computers and accessories, because the demand for services has increased and he needs to keep up with the demand so his business will continue and he can increase his standing in the neighbourhood he is located.

loans.use: to buy three computers and accessories.

loans.name: Ravshan

texts.ru:
Умелый  молодой человек  Равшан один из немногих, которые начали свою деятельность в сфере пекарни  с юношеского возраста. Сейчас ему 26лет и он с детства ходил на ученики к своему дяде «нонвой» (пекарь хлеба). Каждый день, юный Равшан наблюдал за тем, как его дядя замешивал тесто, складывал в кружки и лепил их на тандыр(национальная печь). Он любовался тем, как в  тандыре  пекутся и краснеют национально - таджикские лепёшки.   Это и стала причиной его интереса и привязанности  к мастерству пекаря. 
   Теперь Равшан профессиональный пекарь и занимается этим делом самостоятельно 3 года. Применив свой опыт и приобретённые навыки, он смог открыть свою пекарню.  Также,  он своим делом зарабатывает на жизнь и кормит свою семью. Он женат и у него трое детей.   На сегодня Равшан арендует помещение и имеет одного помощника.  Он  хочет расширить свой бизнес и купить сырье для изготовления лепешек. В надежде на  «светлое будущее» Равшан  решил воспользоваться кредитом,  чтобы бизнес не стоял на месте, и был стабильный доход в семье. И как говорит сам Равшан, « надеюсь,что приобретённый мной кредит оправдает  мои ожидания, я смогу расшириться и мой бизнес  не будет  стоят на месте». 
  На полученный кредит Равшан хочет закупить несколько мешков муки, дрожжи, масло. Он очень старается чтобы его семья не в чем не нуждалась и трудиться день и ночь. Равшан выражает свою благодарность таки организациям как Кива за финансовую поддержку и понимание.
texts.en:
A very capable young man named Ravshan is one of a small number of people that started a business in the field of baking at a young age. He is now 26 years old and when he was a child, he used to apprentice under the guidance of his uncle, who is a "nonvoy" (bread baker.) Every day, young Ravshan observed how his uncle mixed the dough, placed it into a circular baking pan and formed it in a tandoor oven. He watched with admiration how the dough deepened its colour in the tandoor as it baked into Tajikistani national flatbread. This is the reason for his interest in, and attachment to, the profession of baking.
     Now Ravshan is a professional baker and has been working independently for 3 years. By making the most of his experience and acquired skills, he was able to open his own bakery. He can earn his living and feed his family in this way. He is married and has 3 children. At present, he rents his premises and employs one assistant. He wants to expand his business and buy more ingredients to bake flatbread. In the hopes of a bright future, he has decided to seek a loan so that his business does not plateau, and so he can ensure a stable income for his family. As Ravshan himself says, "I hope that the loan I obtain will justify my hope that I can expand, and that my business will not reach a plateau."   
     Ravshan plans to use this loan to purchase several bags of flour, yeast, and butter. He is really striving to make sure that his family does not want for anything, and he works day and night. He extends his gratitude to such organisations as Kiva for the financial support and understanding. 


  
  .

loans.use: to buy baking ingedients

loans.name: Mansurjon

texts.ru:
Мансурджон молодой парень с весёлым и добрым характером.   Он женат и  имеет двоих детей. Жена домохозяйка, занимается воспитанием детей.  Сам он работает на заводе где производят масло.   У Мансурджона хороший доход. Они решили  жить отдельно от родителей и вести самостоятельную жизнь.  Мансурджон планирует провести ремонт в своем доме так как дом нуждается в ремонте, но на ремонт у него нет достаточно денежных средств, все что он зарабатывает на заводе хватает только на проживание.  Он мечтает, чтобы его дети жили и росли в хороших условиях и Мансурджон старается делать все,чтобы осуществить свои планы. 
 На запрашиваемый кредит он хочет купить строительные материалы и сначала начать чинить  крышу своего дома. Потом постепенно копя деньги будет частично ремонтировать весь дом. Мансурджон благодарит организацию Кива за финансовую поддержку.
texts.en:
Mansurjon is a young man with a cheerful and kind disposition. He is married and has two children. His wife stays at home and raises the kids, while Mansurjon works at an oil-producing factory. He has a good income, and the family has decided to live on their own, apart from their parents.

Mansurjon is planning to repair his home, which is in need of work, but does not have enough funds to do so, since everything he earns at the factory is spent on the family's living expenses. Mansurjon dreams of raising his children in best living conditions and tries to do everything to turn these plans into reality. He will use this loan to purchase building materials and begin repairing the roof of his house. Then, as he gradually saves more money, he'll repair the rest of the house step-by-step. Mansurjon thanks Kiva for their financial support.

loans.use: to purchase building materials

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to stock up on merchandise for her grocery store.

loans.name: Gulbahor

texts.ru:
Гулбахор жительница города Турсунзаде. Ей 29 лет. Гулбахор живет с мужем. У них четверо маленьких детей. Ее муж занимается животноводством. Таким образом он зарабатывает и обеспечивает семью.
Гулбахор занимается растениеводством. При доме у нее имеется участок плодородной земли, где она в основном выращивает овощи. Этим видом деятельности Гулбахор занимается 15 лет. Кроме того Гулбахор предоставляет услугу у себя дома. Она занимается шитьем национальных платьев на заказ. В этой области у нее имеется богатый опыт. Так как Гулбахор в пятнадцать лет начала шить платья. 
Гулбахор берет кредит для посева пшеницы. Он хочет посеять и получить богатый урожай для продажи.
texts.en:
Gulbahor lives in the city of Tursun-zoda. She is 29 years old, married, and has 4 small children. Her husband works in animal husbandry, and earns his living and supports his family in this way. Gulbahor raises crops in the fertile plot of land next to her house. She mainly raises vegetables and has been doing this for the last 15 years. Apart from this activity, she provides seamstress services from home, where she fulfills orders to sew national dresses. She has rich experience in this field, having begun sewing at the age of 15. 
Gulbahor is seeking a loan to buy wheat seed. She wants to plant it so she can harvest a good crop for selling.

loans.use: to buy wheat seed and mineral fertilizer

loans.name: Otgonchuluun

texts.en:
Mr. Otgonchuluun is 49 years old. He lives with his wife and six children in a house in the Niseh district of Ulaanbaatar, Mongolia. His wife, Badamhand, works at an administration office of the administrative area. His older two children Lhagvatomor, age 24, and Lhagva-Ochir, age 22, are university students and lived in a dormitory during the previous loan term. His sons Osohbayar, age 17; Osohbat, age 16; and daughters Anujin, age 15; and Anudari, age 14, go to a local school. 

He has been producing leather clothing at home for years as his business. He purchases leather and other inventory from the biggest local market at the lowest possible price and sells his finished goods to local customers. 

He is now requesting 2,500,000 MNT (Mongolian tugriks) to purchase an eco-friendly, electric and gas consuming car to reduce the transportation costs of his business. He is an experienced, hardworking and modest man.

loans.use: to purchase an eco-friendly, electric and gas consuming car to reduce the transportation costs of his business.

loans.name: Millicent

texts.en:
Millicent  is a 35-year-old, married woman. She has three children with ages ranging from 7 years to 14 years. She describes herself to be a humble and caring woman. 

She operates a retail store where she sells household items, such as sugar, salt, maize flour, cooking fat, bread, tea leaves, and sanitary towels. She has been involved in this business for eight years. Her business is located in a potential business area and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be security within the area. 

She will use the KES 21,000 loan to buy a water-harvesting tank which will be used by her four family members on household activities. Her business goal is to expand her business within five years. This is her first loan with SMEP Deposit Taking Microfinance Limited (SMEP DTM).

loans.use: to buy a water tank for her family's use.

loans.name: Elisabeth

texts.fr: Elisabeth est une femme de 38 ans mariée mère de famille.  Elle est commerçante et fait la vente en détail et en gros des vivres frais (tomate et piment) en fonction des saisons dans un marché de la place depuis 15 ans. Elle a une bonne connaissance des fournisseurs, et surtout de sa clientèle qu'elle a acquise au fil du temps grâce à son expérience dans ce domaine. Mais elle se retrouve constamment en rupture de stock parce qu'elle est obligée de faire écouler tous le stock pour pouvoir s'en procurer à nouveau ceci à cause de la petitesse de son capital. Elle souhaitera acheter les cajots de tomate et les filets de piment pour avoir un bon stock ce qui permettra de mieux satisfaire la demande constante de sa clientèle et d'éviter les ruptures de stocks et d'augmenter ses bénéfices. Elle économisera son bénéfice pour non seulement agrandir son activité mais aussi subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.
texts.en:
Elisabeth is a 38-year-old, married mother. She has been buying and selling seasonal, fresh foodstuffs (tomatoes and peppers) in small quantity and in bulk for 15 years now. She sells her goods at a local market.

She knows her suppliers and her customers quite well. She acquired her customers over time thanks to her experience in this line of work. But she often finds herself out of stock, since she has to sell all of her goods before she can restock, due her small amount of capital.

She wants to buy crates of tomatoes and bags of peppers so that she will be well stocked and better able to meet the demand of her customers. Doing so will also prevent her from running out of stock and will help her increase her profits. She will use the profits not only to expand her business but also to support her family.

loans.use: to buy crates of tomatoes and bags of peppers

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en: Lolita, 59, is a widow and has two children. She lives in Militar, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur. She has been in fishing business for three years. This activity enables her to earn a monthly income of 6,000 PHP for her family. She would like to make her business more profitable, so she decided to ask for a micro-credit loan from GDMPC for 12,000 PHP in order to repair her fishing boat. She is eager to increase her income in the next months.

loans.use: to repair her fishing boat

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a water tank

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy chickens for her husband's meat-selling business.

loans.name: Remedios

texts.en:
As a widowed mother of three children, Remedios works hard to support her family. She has a general store business in the Philippines, and earns additional income from food vending. Having repaid her previous loan, Remedios is requesting a new one for PHP 19500 through NWTF to buy items to sell such as canned goods, soap, milk, soft drinks, etc. for her store.

Remedios has been sustaining her business activities through her past 28 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, soap, milk, soft drinks, etc.

loans.name: Sauni

texts.en:
Sauni, a 50-year-old married mother of five, is a peasant farmer involved in the growing of cassavas, pineapples and bananas, an enterprise she has been operating for the last 30 years as a source of income to look after her family. Her major challenges are the changing weather patterns and price fluctuations of agricultural products.

Sauni is requesting a loan of 1,500,000 shillings to complete the construction of her residential home so that her family can have a decent living environment. Her dream is to advance her agricultural business to a commercial level and thereby enjoy a good financial return.

loans.use: to complete her residential home.

loans.name: Sonrisa Group

texts.es:
Doña Nisha es otro integrante del grupo Sonrisa, ella es una mujer muy amistosa y emprendedora, Ella solo estudio la preparatoria, esta casada con don Jose Luis y tiene dos hijos. Doña Nisha plaica que ella tiene 12 años siendo comerciante inicio vendiando cosmeticos y hace unos años le ofrecieron el vender antojitos mexicanos en una cooperativa escolar como vio que la oportunidad era buena la acepto y actualmente esta es su actividad economica.

Ella realiza sus ventas de lunes a viernes en la hora del recreo de los niños(la media hora que da la escuela para el desayuno), pero su trabajo inicia desde muy temprano con la preparacion de dicha comida ya que cuando llega a vender a la escuela ya todo debe estar listo pra venderse, ella tambien vende dulces, aguas y refrescos.

ella dijo "a mi me gusta mucho mi trabajo porque solo es por la mañana y el resto de la tarde lo tengo libre para atender a mi familia y hacer mi trabajo en casa"

Este crédito lo invertirá en la compra de  carne, chiles, tomates, cebolla, maíz, tortillas, crema, queso, aguacate, col, frijol, papas,  gas, plátanos, huevos, aceite papel aluminio, dulces y refrescos para continuar con sus ventas.

Ella espera a futuro poder brindar a sus hijos la oportunidad de asistir a la universidad para que les vaya mejor en la vida.

Los demas integrantes del gruppo son:
Guadalupe venta de cosmeticos 
Jesika venta de dulces 
Estela venta de comida
Grissel vebta de abarrotes
Lorena venta de ropa 
Minerva servicio de imprenta 
Felipa venta de ropa
texts.en:
Mrs. Nisha is a member of the ”Sonrisa” [Smile] group. She is a friendly and enterprising woman who finished secondary school. Nisha is married to Jose Luis and has two children. She says that she has been a saleswoman for twelve years and that she started this line of work selling cosmetics. Some years ago, somebody offered her to start selling Mexican snacks in a cooperative at school; she though it was a good idea and that is today her main economic activity.

She works Monday to Friday during the kids’ morning breaks (thirty minutes they have for having breakfast). However, she has to prepare the food in advance, early every morning. Once she arrives to the school, everything must be ready to be sold. She sells also sweets, water and beverages. Mrs. Nisha said: "I love my job because I have to work only in the morning. In the afternoon, I have free time to take care of my family and my house.”

She will use this loan to buy meat, chilies, tomatoes, onion, corn, tortillas, cream, cheese, avocado, cabbage, beans, potatoes, bananas, eggs, oil, sweets, beverages, gas for cooking and aluminum foil. She needs all these things to continue with her sales.

In the future, she hopes to provide her children with the opportunity to go to the university, so that they have a better life than hers.

The remaining group members are:
Guadalupe: cosmetics sales.
Jesika: sweets sales.
Estela: food sales.
Grissel: grocery store.
Lorena: clothes sales.
Minerva: printing business.
Felipa: clothes sales.

loans.use: to buy meat, chilies, tomatoes, onion, beverages, cooking gas, aluminum foil and other supplies for her business.

loans.name: Gloria Zulema

texts.es: Gloria, tiene 41 años de edad, casada, tiene dos hijos, vive con su esposo y una hija en el municipio de la Esperanza Intibucá. Ella tiene aproximadamente 17 años de dedicarse al comercio, tiene un puesto de venta en un mercado local, donde vende ropa y zapatos de todo tipo para damas, caballeros y niños. Ha mantenido estable económicamente su negocio mediante la inversión de varios préstamos. El préstamo que solicita es el cuarto ciclo y es por 20,000 lempiras, el cual lo invertirá en la compra de mercadería principalmente uniformes escolares y calzado, ya que es la temporada escolar y necesita tener producto. Su meta es siempre seguir creciendo con el negocio.
texts.en:
Gloria, age 41, is married and has two children.  She lives with her husband and daughter in the Esperanza Intibucá municipality.  She has been working in commerce for approximately 17 years.  She has a sales stand at a local market.  She sells clothes and all types of shoes for women, men, and children.  

She has kept her business financially stable through the investment of various loans.  The loan she is requesting is her fourth cycle, and it is for 20,000 lempiras.  She will use the loan to buy merchandise, mainly school uniforms and shoes.  She will do this because it is now the school season, and she needs to have products.  Her goal is for her business to always grow.

loans.use: to buy shoes and school uniforms to sell.

loans.name: Roger Amilcar

texts.es: Roger, tiene 34 años de edad, vive en unión libre con su esposo y tienen dos hijos, su vivienda esta en una colonia suburbana de San Pedro Sula. Anteriormente el realizaba trabajos de construcción de viviendas, pero hace un año decidió dedicarse al comercio. Vende ropa como blusas, pantalones, camisetas, sandalias y tenis. Las ventas las realiza de manera ambulante. El ha decidido obtener este préstamo que es por 7,000 Lempiras para comprar más producto de ropa y calzado. Esta inversión le permitirá contar con mejores ingresos ya que comprando de contado y en cantidades le queda ganancia. Tiene como meta hacer crecer el negocio para poder ayudar a su familia y salir de la pobreza. Agradece mucho el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Roger, age 34, is in a common-law marriage and has two children.  He lives with them in a suburban neighborhood of San Pedro Sula.  He used to do construction work on houses.  However, one year ago he decided to work in commerce.

He sells clothes like blouses, pants, t-shirts, sandals, and tennis shoes.  He sells in an itinerant manner.  He decided to get this loan for 7,000 lempiras in order to buy more shoes and clothes.  This investment will allow him to have better income.  By purchasing for cash and in volume he gets more profit.  

His goal is to make his business grow in order to be able to help his family and to get out of poverty.  He is very grateful for the given support.

loans.use: to buy clothes, sandals, and tennis shoes to stock his business.

loans.name: Felister

texts.en:
Felister  is a married woman. She describes herself to be a humble and ambitious woman. She operates a retail business where she sells onions. Her business is located in a viable business area and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be competition from other business people. 

Felister will use the KES 78,000 loan to buy a water tank, which will be used by her nuclear and extended family of 20 members. Her business goal is to be an onion distributor within five years. 

This is her fourth loan with SMEP Deposit Taking Microfinance Limited (SMEP DTM). Previously, she took loans in the amounts of KES 20,000, KES 50,000 and KES 80,000, which she managed to successfully pay. She aspires to have a decent home with complete provision of water for the household activities.

loans.use: to purchase a water tank, which will be used by 20 family members.

loans.name: Javzandulam

texts.en: Mrs. Javzandulam is 56 years old. She lives with her husband and two children in a house in Orhon province, Mongolia. Her husband Bayantes, age 56, is retired and stays home. Her daughter Altanhurts, age 26, works at a local company. Her son Gantomor, age 23, is a junior student at university. She has been running her business selling organic dairy products in a local market since 2004. She has built close relationship with her customers and suppliers. She is now requesting 607,500 MNT to purchase organic dairy products from suppliers to sell to local customers. She is a hardworking, optimistic, and honest woman.

loans.use: to purchase organic dairy products

loans.name: Esterlita

texts.en: Esterlita is a 49-year-old single woman from Talibon, Bohol. She engages in farming. She grows rice. She has been growing rice for 8 years. Esterlita earns 7,500 PHP a month by doing the farming. She requested a loan of 8,000 PHP to buy rice seedlings and fertilizers to have a bountiful harvest. Esterlita would like to invest in other business ventures to improve her livelihood.

loans.use: to buy rice seedlings and fertilizers.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: Esther is a married woman. She has 3 children that range in age from 1 to 14 years. She describes herself to be hard working, caring and warm woman. She operates a retail shop where she sells household items such as sugar, salt, maize flour, tea leaves, etc. Her business is located in a visible business area and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be high prices of household items. She will use the KES 8,700 loan to buy a water tank which will be used by her five family members. Her business goal is to expand her business within 5 years. This is her second loan with SMEP DTM after taking a loan of KES 20,000 which she managed to pay back successfully.

loans.use: to buy a water tank for her family of five.

loans.name: Mwanakombo

texts.en:
Mwanakombo is 51 years old.  She is married, has five children, and lives in the city of Tirebe Mombasa, Kenya. She has a hotel. She says she started with a small cafe and later changed areas and now has a hotel. It has gone very well for her, with regular customers because of well cooked food.
She is requesting the loan amounting to ksh.10,000 to buy beverages, canned goods, vegetables, and other supplies for her business because these are the most popular. She is grateful for the help she gets because it will be very useful to her.

loans.use: to buy beverages, canned goods, vegetables to use during mealtimes for her hotel guests.

loans.name: Akpar

texts.en:
Akpar is 32 years old. He lives in the small village of Lagodekhi District with his wife and 3 sons. Akpar requested loan from local financial institutions several times for a family business start-up, but without any success. His loan requests were rejected, because of low income and family’s poor living conditions.

Akpar trades seasonal fruits and vegetables. He buys a stock of fruits and vegetables from the wholesalers and then sells them locally at a higher price. It is hardly enough to provide food for the family. According to Credo estimations the family belongs to the subsistence poor category.

Akpar requested a loan from Credo to start-up a family business. His loan request was approved in the frames of new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to country rural poor, which do not have access to credit products, being regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of low income. With the received credit Akpar will build a greenhouse. After building a greenhouse, he plans to sow tomatoes and cucumbers. He will sell the harvested products locally at a good price. This will increase the income of the family. The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva Start-up loan will significantly improve the living conditions of the family.

loans.use: to build a greenhouse to grow tomatoes and cucumbers.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy embroidery materials to complete a large order.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is single, 25 years of age. He is a motorcycle rider which he is doing as a source of income to look after himself and his dependents. Joseph started this business two years back, after dropping out of school because his parents could not pay his tuition.

He wants a loan of UGX 2,500,000/= (two million and five hundred thousand shillings) to complete payment of his new motorcycle. Joseph hopes that this new motorcycle will help him make more money -- since it will be new, it will attract more customers to him. With the income, he will be in better position to provide for the family.

The major challenges Joseph faces are the poor road network that leads to the mechanical breakdown of the motorcycle and the weather, most especially when it rains, which puts him out of work. Joseph wants the lender to always extend financial support to him and see his life progressing.

loans.use: to complete payment of his new motorcycle.

loans.name: Jonny Eduardo

texts.es:
Jonny es un hombre joven de 23 años, es soltero, cursó los estudios primarios en una escuela pública del sector  y vive en el Cantón Santo Domingo de la provincia de Santo Domingo de los Tsáchilas. Santo Domingo se encuentra conectando la Región Sierra con la Región Costa del Ecuador, es una ciudad que se ha convertido en un eje comercial con varios sectores en crecimiento y como prueba se tiene a varias familias emprendedoras que hace algunos años comenzaron con pequeños negocios y ahora son microempresarios que aportan a la generación de empleo. Los estudios revelan que todos los negocios en su mayoría, empezaron empíricamente y han tenido acogida por el paso de turistas, empresarios y viajeros que se trasladan de una región a otra y además que es la tercera ciudad más habitada en el país. Jonny reside en la Parroquia Luz de América de este cantón, un sector que es considerado como el portón de entrada a la Provincia, por la riqueza de su tierra, ha sido el nido de varias empresas productoras de alimentos además que es la zona de mayor producción de papaya, fruta exótica exportada desde aquí. Es por esto que los habitantes de esta parroquia en su gran mayoría, se dedican a la agricultura y también a la ganadería lo cual ha sido la motivación para que varios emprendedores de la zona fortalezcan esta actividad con su trabajo, experiencia y  esfuerzo.
Jonny es un hombre que desde niño aprendió con sus padres a criar animales de todo tipo, su ayuda era esencial para que sus padres cumplieran a cabalidad el trabajo que realizaban para tener el sustento diario en casa. Desde hace 2 años ejerce independientemente el trabajo de criar cerdos y patos para su posterior venta, Jonny está pendiente del alimento, salud, estadía de sus animales para que luego éstos se vendan en un buen precio en el mercado, estas tareas le llevan desde 8 horas cada día en distintos horarios dependiendo de las necesidades de los animales y las condiciones del clima. Jonny ha visto la necesidad de ampliar y adecuar los galpones en donde permanecen sus animales para lo cual ha solicitado un préstamo con el que además comprará balanceado al por mayor para obtener un mejor precio con su proveedor. Jonny ha tenido dificultad para obtener créditos anteriormente en  varias instituciones financieras por vivir en una parroquia rural a varios kilómetros de la ciudad lo que le impedía ser atendido por la dificultad para los ejecutivos de crédito de llegar hasta su hogar. Gracias a Fundación Alternativa, esta barrera ha sido superada, pues preocupados justamente por las personas del sector rural y a través de Kiva hoy por hoy Jonny puede recibir el apoyo que necesita para crecer como un microempresario, sueño en el cual muchos de ustedes formarán parte!!...
texts.en:
Jonny is a young 23 year old single man. He completed his primary school education in a public school in the area and lives in Santo Domingo canton in the province of Santo Domingo de los Tsáchilas. Santo Domingo connects the mountainous and coastal regions of Ecuador. It is a city that has become a commercial hub with several growth sectors and as proof you have several enterprising families that began some years ago with small businesses which have now become small enterprises contributing to job growth. Studies reveal that a majority of the businesses began by trial ad error and that they have been well received by passing tourists, businessmen and travelers who move from one region to another. Moreover, Santo Domingo is the third most populous city in the country. 

Jonny lives in Luz de América parish in this canton, an area considered the gateway to the province because of the richness of its soil. It has been the birthplace of several food companies as well as the area of greatest papaya production and exportation of exotic fruit. Consequently most of the inhabitants of the parish engage in agriculture and also livestock raising, a factor motivating several entrepreneurs in the area to strengthen these enterprises through their work, experience and effort.

Jonny is a man who, from the time he was a child, learned how to raise all kinds of animals from his parents. His help was essential so that his parents could meet their responsibilities of putting food on the table. For the past two years Jonny has been working independently raising pigs and ducks for later re-sale. He manages their feeding and health needs during their stay before selling them at market for a good price. These tasks take about 8 hours every day on different schedules depending on the needs of the animals and weather conditions.

Jonny has seen the need to expand and upgrade the sheds where his animals stay and has requested a loan for this purpose as well as to buy animal feed wholesale so that he can obtain the best price from his provider. Previously, Jonny has had difficulty obtaining loans from various financial institutions because he lives in a rural parish several kilometers from the city and this has made it difficult for the loan officers to make the long trip required to reach his house. Thanks to Fundación Alternativa, this barrier has been overcome since they care about people in rural areas, and thanks to Kiva,  today Jonny is able to receive the help that he needs to grow as a small business man, a dream that many of you are a part of!!

loans.use: to upgrade his livestock sheds and to pay for animal feed.

loans.name: Joel

texts.en: Joel  is 37 years old, married and the father of three children who range in age from 5 months to 15 years old. He operates a retail business where he sells cereals, and describes himself as honest. His business is located at a busy market and most of his customers are local residents. He describes his biggest business challenge as poor infrastructure at his business location. He will use this Kes. 8,700 loan to buy a water tank for his family. His goal is to expand his business within the next five years. This is his third loan with SMEP DTM and he paid back his previous ones.

loans.use: to buy a water tank.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en: Evelyn works hard to support her family by running a general store in the Philippines. She is requesting a loan for PHP 12,000 through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, spices, canned goods and milk. Evelyn has been in business for eight years. Her goal for the future is to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy sweaters for a thread-making business.

loans.name: Libia  Del  Socorro

texts.es: Libia de 50 años de edad es una mujer casada y madre de 2 hijos mayores de edad, que vivió en la ciudad de Cartagena de Indias, llamada también la heroica, ubicada en la costa  norte de Colombia, como una estrella en el mar caribe. En este hermoso y caluroso ambiente desde hace 15 años organizó su microempresa de confecciones, siguiendo la tradición de su familia, dedicada principalmente a las actividades de modistería. Sus principales líneas de ropa son los vestidos femeninos, blusas y pantalones, además de uniformes, con los que trabaja usualmente cuando obtiene contratos. Ella vende a crédito a 7 días mientras realiza sus compras de contado con esa misma frecuencia. Sus metas de abordar nuevos clientes son permanentes, pero tiene un capital de trabajo con el cual no alcanza a cumplir sus propósitos. Esta es la razón por la cual acude aun credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el cual comprará telas, hilos, correderas e insumos de confección para fabricar nuevos diseños ajustados a la demanda que en la actualidad presenta. Esta es justamente su razón de éxito en la inversión de su credikiva, porque responderá a la demanda del mercado y su experiencia le permite seleccionar su clientela de mejor comportamiento de pago.
texts.en: 50-year-old Libia is a married woman and has two adult children. She lives in the town of Cartagena de Indias, also known as "la heroica" ("the heroic one"), located in the northern coast of Colombia like a star in the Caribbean sea. It was in these charming and warm surroundings that she first started her sewing business 15 years ago, following her family's tradition of working mainly in dressmaking-related activities. Her main lines of work are women's dresses, blouses and pants, and also uniforms, which she usually makes when she gets contracts. She sells on credit of 7 days, all the while making her purchases by cash every 7 days as well. Her goal of gaining new customers is enduring, but the working capital that she has is not enough to accomplish this purpose. That's the reason why she requests a Kiva loan, her first loan with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. She'll use it to purchase fabric, thread, zippers and sewing supplies so that she can make new designs in accordance with the current demands. That's precisely the reason why her Kiva loan will be successful - because it will meet the demands of the market, and also because her experience allows her to select the customers with the best credit record.

loans.use: to purchase fabric, thread, zippers and sewing supplies.

loans.name: Jona

texts.en:
Jona is 40 years old and married. She works very hard to save for the future.

Jona runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 16000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks to sell like snack foods, spices, sugar, etc.

Jona has been in this business for 2 years.
In the future, Jona would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks to sell like snack foods, spices, sugar, etc.

loans.name: Melanie

texts.en:
Melanie works hard to support her family. Melanie is married and has a fish vending business in the Philippines.

Melanie requested a PHP 25000 loan through NWTF to buy additional fish to sell.

Melanie has been in this business for 8 years now.

In the future, Melanie would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional fish to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more sacks of charcoal.

loans.name: Mwanamisi

texts.en: Mwanamisi is 21 years old and married to Hamadi. They have two children, so both of them work tirelessly to provide them with everything they need to have a better life. She owns a store selling utensils. She is requesting the loan amounting to KSH 15,000 to buy more utensils to restock her shop. She is grateful for the help because it will be very useful to her.

loans.use: to buy more utensils to restock her shop.

loans.name: Monte De Bendicion 1, 2 & 3 Group

texts.en:
Francisca is a member of the group "Monte de Bendicion" (Mount of Blessing) 1, 2 & 3. This group is located in the urban slums surrounding Santo Domingo. The members are dedicated to doing business around their community and other villages, selling clothing, shoes, cosmetics, underwear and many other products.

Francisca sells used clothes that she buys by the bag. Each bag or packet has around one hundred pieces of good quality secondhand clothes. For Dominicans and Haitians, it is very popular to buy clothes like this. Most of them are good quality and have cheap prices. Francisca sells them from her house and from a flea market. She will use this loan to buy four bags of secondhand clothes, and with her business profits, she will continue reinvesting in her business.

Francisca lives with her husband and their four children. She dreams of having a successful business. She enjoys working at her home and running her business. She thanks you all for your support!

loans.use: To buy four bags of secondhand clothing.

loans.name: Nashon

texts.en:
Nashon is a married man. He has five children, with ages ranging from 2 years to 10 years. He describes himself to be a humble and honest man. 

Nashon operates a retail business where he sells ropes. His business is located in a busy market and his primary customers are local residents. He describes his biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds for improving the business. 

He will use the KES 8,700 loan to buy a water tank which will be used by his family members.

loans.use: to buy a water tank for use by his family.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.fr: Agnès est une femme de 38 ans mariée mère de 8 enfants dont l'age varie entre 2 et 25 ans 5 d'entre eux vont à l'école. Elle est commerçante et fait la vente en détail et en gros des vivres frais (tomate et piment) en fonction des saisons dans un marché de la place depuis 17 ans. Elle a une bonne connaissance des fournisseurs, et surtout de sa clientèle qu'elle a acquise au fil du temps grâce à son expérience dans ce domaine. Mais elle se retrouve constamment en rupture de stock parce qu'elle est obligée de faire écouler tous le stock pour pouvoir s'en procurer à nouveau ceci à cause de la petitesse de son capital. Elle souhaitera acheter les cajots de tomate et les filets de piment pour avoir un bon stock ce qui permettra de mieux satisfaire la demande constante de sa clientèle et d'éviter les ruptures de stocks et d'augmenter ses bénéfices. Elle économisera son bénéfice pour non seulement agrandir son activité mais aussi subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.
texts.en:
Agnès, age 38, is a married mother of eigth children aged 2 to 25, five of whom attend school. She is a merchant who has been selling seasonal produce (tomatoes and peppers) at retail and wholesale at a local market for the past 17 years. She knows her suppliers well, and she has a keen understanding of her customer base, which her experience has helped her to build over time. 

However, her limited capital forces her to sell all of her merchandise before she can replenish her stock, which results in frequent shortages. 

She plans to buy cases of tomatoes and bags of peppers to have the stock necessary to better meet customer demand, to prevent shortages, and to bolster her sales. She will save her profits to expand her business and to take care of her family.

loans.use: to buy cases of tomatoes and bags of peppers.

loans.name: Hijos Del Sol Group

texts.es:
Este BC se llama “Hijos del Sol”, lo componen 19 emprendedores, todos tienen distintos negocios hay electricistas, tapiceros, fotógrafos, artesanos, vendedores de ropas, costureras, entre otros. Todos viven en la comuna de Independencia, ciudad de Santiago.
América, aparece en la foto sentada con su hija, viste falda floreada y polera negra; vende ropa para mujeres, hace dos años que se dedica a este rubro, envía a confeccionar sus modelos, haciendo diseños exclusivos con la ayuda de dos diseñadores, compra su mercadería en un conocido barrio comercial de telas, cerca de su domicilio. Además se dedica a la venta de perfumes, los adquiere en distribuidoras.
Trabaja desde su casa,  puerta a puerta y también a pedidos. Nos comenta que además trabaja como asesora de hogar en la comuna de Las Condes, lejos de su casa, hace 15 años, cuando llegó a Chile. ( viene de Perú)
Le ha dado uso a su crédito en comprar nuevas telas para esta temporada.
Su sueño es poner una tienda en el sector alto de Santiago, donde ha notado un mejor público y más demanda. 
Lo que motiva a América en continuar su negocio es dar una seguridad económica a sus hijos, vive sola con sus 3 hijos, al tener ingresos extras, le permitirá pagar la educación de su familia.
Le ha gustado trabajar con Fondo Esperanza porque le enseñan a valorar su negocio, apoyarse unos a otros y por la buena relación humana que existe, sobre todo al ser extranjera, ha tenido buena acogida del grupo.
Independencia es una de las 34 comunas que componen la ciudad de Santiago (capital de Chile), ubicada en el sector centro-norte. Surgió a fines del siglo XIX como un sector tradicional de la ciudad. Su eje principal es la Av. Independencia, por la cual pasaba el antiguo Camino del Inca, puerta de entrada por el norte, a la ciudad de Santiago. Dada su amplia población indígena, en Independencia se encuentra el Centro Cultural Indígena de Chile. Cuenta también con importantes construcciones históricas, entre ellas 6 monumentos históricos de Chile.
texts.en:
This communal bank is called "Hijos del Sol" ("children of the sun", in English) and has eighteen entrepreneurs, all of whom have different businesses.  There are electricians, upholsterers, photographers, craftsmen, clothes vendors and dressmakers, among others.  All of the entrepreneurs live in the Independencia commune, in the city of Santiago.

In flowery shorts and a black top, kneeling with her daughter in the photo is América.  For two years now she has been selling clothes.  She has exclusive designs, created with the help of two designers and she sends for her patterns to be made.  She buys her merchandise in a district known for its fabric shops, near to her home.  In addition, she sells perfumes, which she buys from distributors.

She works from home, going door to door and takes orders.  She says that she also worked as a home assessor in the Las Condes commune, which is far for her home.  She did this 15 years ago when she came to Chile (América is Peruvian).

She has used her loan to buy new fabrics for the season.

América's dream is to have a shop in uptown Santiago, where she has seen that there is a better market and more demand.

América is motivated to work away at her business so that she can give financial security to her children.  She lives with her three children and with a higher income she will be able to pay for their education.

She has liked working with Fondo Esperanza as they teach her to value her business and teach members to support each other.  She also likes the relationship with others, particularly as a foreigner.  She has been warmly welcomed into the group.

Independencia, in the north of the city, is one of the 34 communes that make up Chile's capital, Santiago.  It emerged at the end of the nineteenth century as a traditional area.  Its centre is Avenida Independencia, the road along which the ancient "Camino del Inca" (Inca path) ran.  This was the main entry from the north into the city of Santiago.  Given its large indigenous population, it is in Independencia that you find Chile's Indigenous Culture Centre.  The area also has various significant, historic buildings, including six of the country's monuments.

loans.use: to buy fabrics for making new clothes designs.

loans.name: Josinta

texts.en: Josinta is 30 years old, married and the mother of three children who attend school and whose ages are 2, 13 and 15 years old. She is a hardworking woman who earns a living by selling second-hand clothes, and takes home a monthly income of KES. 50,000. She is requesting her fifth loan from KADET LTD and will use it to buy clothing to sell from her suppliers in Nairobi and Mombasa. She will use the profits she expects to earn to pay school fees and expand her business. Her goal for the future is to earn a stable income.

loans.use: to buy more used clothing to sell.

loans.name: Fadak 1 Group

texts.en:
Zeinab is the featured borrower of the Fadak 1 Group. She applied for a group YOUTH LOAN from Kiva partner Al Majmoua, because they have always been neighbors and friends. Zeinab is a 28-year-old married woman, mother of four children; a daughter Ahlam, 11, a son Hassan, 10, a daughter Fatima, 7, and daughter Fadak, 2.  Zeinab has been selling creams and cosmetics for 2 years, to help her husband make a living for their family and covering their expenses.
With the requested loan, Zeinab will increase her products with special winter beauty creams and cosmetics. She is working from her house, but she will work hard to open her own shop.
She is the first one from the left.
Amina is a 22-year-old single woman, who has been working as a nurse for a year and a half. With the requested loan, she intends to start selling clothes to increase her income, and improve her living. She is the one seated on the right.
Nour is an 18-year-old single woman, who has worked as a sales person in a detergents shop for the last 7 months. With the amount requested she intends to buy a laptop that will help her improve her IT Knowledge.

loans.use: to increase her products with special winter beauty creams and cosmetics.

loans.name: Margie

texts.en: Margie is 57 years old, married, and has five children. She works very hard to provide for them. Margie runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 40,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more items to sell like canned goods, spices, soap, noodles, etc. Margie has been in this business for 25 years. In the future Margie would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase items such as canned goods, spices, soap, noodles, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase chicken for roasting

loans.name: Nomi

texts.en: Nomi is 44 years old, married and the mother of two children. She works very hard to provide for her family by running a general store in the Philippines. She is requesting a loan for PHP 15,000 from NWTF to buy more items, such as shampoo, noodles and sugar, to sell to her customers. She has been in this line of work for 10 years and would like to earn enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Jose Luis

texts.es:
José   tiene 39 años. Es soltero no tiene  hijos. El  tomo la decisión de tener su propio Gabinete de Belleza cuando vivía en la cdla. Los esteros, ya que siempre le gusto esta actividad el decidió continuar cuando se cambio de domicilio en la nueva properina. 

Jose realiza en el Gabinete de Belleza  cortes para damas, caballeros y niños. También hace permanentes para el cabello, peinados, etc. Trabajo con mucho entusiasmo porque le gusta mucho su profesión; los cortes de cabello para mujeres están a un valor de $ 3.50, de caballeros a $ 2.50, los de niños están a $ 2.00. 

Una de sus dificultades para hacer su trabajo en el Gabinete es la delincuencia, la falta de tiempo y las épocas lluviosas. Jose tiene muchas aspiraciones para su negocio por eso quiere el préstamo para comprar secadora, sofá para peinar a los hombres, maquilladora. 

En la entrevista Jose dijo: 
Mis aspiraciones y metas en un futuro para mi negocio tener la clientela necesaria para poder tener más ingresos, y así ayudar a mis familiares en lo que pueda y dar empleo a mis amigos para ayudarlos.
texts.en:
Jose is 39 years old and single with no children. He decided to open his own beauty salon when he was living in the community of Los Esteros. Since he always enjoyed this line of work, he decided to continue when he moved to a new community.

Jose offers haircuts for women, men, and children in the beauty salon. He also offers perms and styles hair, among other services. He works with plenty of enthusiasm because he likes his profession very much. Women's haircuts cost $3.50, men's cost $2.50, and children's cuts cost $2.00.

Some difficulties which Jose faces working in the salon are crime, a lack of time, and rainy periods. Jose has many aspirations for his business. Therefore, he is applying for a loan to buy a hair dryer and a sofa for men's hairstyles, and makeup.

In an interview, Jose said: "My aspirations and goals for my business in the future are to have the necessary clientele to have a better income, to help my relatives as much as I can, and to offer employment to my friends in order to help them."

loans.use: to buy a sofa and a hair dryer for styling men's hair.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en: Jane repaid her last loan and from the proceeds joined a group of other farmers who are undertaking livestock farming. She has requested a second loan from KADET LTD to buy livestock to fatten and later sell. Jane will use the anticipated profits to provide for basic family needs and to educate her children.

loans.use: to purchase livestock to fatten and later sell.

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
Rosita is applying for a loan of $ 1.000.00 from TRM (Tuba Rai Metin). She is 29 years old. She runs a shop in the market and she will use the loan to buy food to keep in her store such as tofu, chicken and vegetables. She is making good money from the shop and she wants to apply for a bigger loan in the future.
Rosita is living in a town near the market. Her shop is located in a strategic place where many people, including students from nearby schools, come to buy items.

loans.use: To buy tofu, chicken and vegetables.

loans.name: Rodyly

texts.en:
Rodyly is 28 years old and married with 2 children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Rodyly runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20000 loan through NWTF to buy more stocks to sell like soap, sugar, noodles, spices, canned goods, etc.

Rodyly has been in this business for 3 years.
In the future, Rodyly would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stocks to sell like soap, sugar, noodles, spices, canned goods, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy beef, pork, and cold meats in larger quantities.

loans.name: Manuela Cristina

texts.es: Doña Cristina es una mujer muy dedicada, desde que inicio a trabajar con el crédito siempre ha visto la manera de sobresalir en sus negocios para poder mejorar la calidad de vida de sus hijos. Doña Cristi, como de cariño le dicen, platica que tiene 52 años de edad, está casada con el señor Silverio desde hace 36 años; juntos formaron una familia con seis hijos sin embrago ya todos son independientes. Ella no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar, pero tiene varios negocios que le han servido para solventar los gastos de su hogar. Esta vez está solicitando un crédito a Vision Fund y KIVA para abastecer su tienda de abarrotes y otra parte será para comprar condimentos para la preparación de las tortas que también vende, Platica que su tienda la inicio desde hace 10 años nunca imagino llegar a tener un negocio que le ayudara tanto sin embargo cuenta que se vio muy motivada por su esposo pero también por iniciativa propia porque veía que con el trabajo de su esposo no alcanza para solventar gastos de educación de sus hijos y para gastos del hogar, en la preparación de sus tortas lleva poco tiempo ya que anteriormente vendía comidas pero muchas veces no le alcanza para comprar todo necesita dinero para comprarse unos buenos utensilios de cocina una buena vajilla, etc. Para poder levantar nuevamente su cocina económica es una meta que tiene a corto plazo el crédito le ayudara para comprar algunas cosas. Doña Cristi platica que no tiene una gran dificultad en cuanto a su tienda de abarrotes aunque sí le afecta un poco la inseguridad que se está viviendo hoy en día. Doña Cristi además de la tienda de abarrotes, la cocina económica, también atiende la escuela escolar cuenta que la mayor parte del día trabaja ahí mientras que su nuera atiende la tienda y la cocina económica, Doña Cristi tiene la gran esperanza de que sus negocios funcionen muy bien que generen ganancias para poder mejorar la calidad de vida de ella y de su esposo. Ella está muy agradecida con Vision Fund y KIVA por el crédito ya que por varios ciclos le han otorgado el crédito y ha podido mantener sus negocios.
texts.en:
Since she began working with the institution, Cristina, a determined woman, has always managed to move her business forward so that she can enhance the well being of her children. Cristi, as her friends call her, is 52, and has been married to Silverio for 36 years. They have six children, who now live on their own. She did not have the opportunity to go to school, but she has several businesses that help pay her household expenses. 

She is applying to Vision Fund and Kiva for a loan to stock her grocery store and to buy condiments to make the sandwiches she sells. She opened her store 10 years ago and never imagined that the business would be so helpful. Her husband supported her initiative because his income alone would not cover their children's  education and household expenses.

It takes Cristi little time to prepare the sandwiches because she used to sell food; however, at times she doesn't have enough money to buy good cooking utensils, dishes, and so forth. The loan will help her buy items now to get her kitchen running again. Cristi says that the grocery store is going well, though the uncertainty she is experiencing today is somewhat worrisome. In addition to running the grocery store and kitchen, Cristi attends school. She works most of the day, and her daughter-in-law helps her in the store and kitchen.

Cristi expects both of her businesses to be successful and generate income to improve her and her husband's lives. She is grateful to Vision Fund and Kiva for the loans they have granted her to sustain her businesses.

loans.use: to buy milk, bread, eggs, sugar, beverages, etc.

location.town: Rioyos Buenavista, San Felipe del Progreso

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy grocery items for supplying grocery stores.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a water tank for the use of her family.

loans.name: Alcatraz Group

texts.es: Esta es la segunda vez que el grupo "Alcatraz" solicita credito a la institucion anteriormente eran solo cuatro integrantes pero dos personas se sumaron al grupo. Comentan que les gusto mucho trabajar con Vision Found y KIVA es por eso que han decidido volver a renovar su credito. El nombre del grupo lo elijieron ellos mismos porque alcatraz significa anbudancia, Doña Ceci es integrante del grupo platica que tiene 49 años de edad esta casada con el señor Genaro quien trabaja en el campo juntos han formado una familia con 10 niños de los cuales aun tres de ellos dependen de dicha pareja ellos aun se encuentran estudiando Doña Ceci tiene una pequeña tienda de abarrotes que inicio desde hace un año cuenta que la inicio porque ya tenian los locales preparados solo que no habian definido bien que negocio poner finalmente decidieron poner la tiendita de abarrotes La señora Ceci platica que esta muy contenta por el logro que ha tenido en su negocio porque sus ganancias han ayudado a mejorar la calidad de vida de sus hijos y de ellos para padres pero lo que mas le gusta a Doña Ceci es platicar con sus clientes le emociona mucho saber de como estan sus clientes. Doña Ceci comento "Me gusta mucho mi negocio solo que mi unica dificultad es la falta de un refrigerador para poder vender carmes frias, yogurt, porque yo antes ya vendia queso pero por falta del refrigerador tuve que dejar de vender porque se me echaba a perder muy rapido" Pero a pesar de esto Doña Ceci esta muy contenta y agradecida con Vision Fund y KIVA por el credito otorgado ya que gracias a la ayuda económica ella podra realizar su sueño es llegar hacer mas grande su tienda de abarrotes donde pueda vender de todo entre risas comento "Casi casi una miselanea" para que ella pueda tener un sustento necesario para que sus hijos puedan tener una mejor educacion, Asi como Doña Ceci tiene sueños tambien los integrantes del grupo es por eso que han solicitado el credito para invertir en sus actividades Juan en su invernadero de frambruesa, Virginia en su molino de nixtamal, Raudel en aceite para autos, Sara en ropa y finalmente Don Guillermo en su taxi.
texts.en: This is the second time that the "Alcatraz" group has applied for a loan from the communal bank.  Before, there were only four members but two more have now joined.  They say that they really enjoyed working with Vision Found and Kiva and so decided to come back for another loan.  The members themselves chose the group's name as "alcatraz" means "abundance".  Ceci is one member of the group.  She is 49 years old and married to Genaro, who works in the country.  Together they have a family with ten children, three of whom still depend on their parents as they are studying.  Ceci has a small grocery story that she started a year ago.  She says that she already had premises but she just had not decided exactly what kind of business to have.  She finally opted for a small grocery store.  Ceci tells us she is very happy with the success she has had with her business as her earning have helped to improve her children and her and her husband's living conditions.  However, what she most likes is being able to chat with customers, and she is always excited to know how they are.  Ceci said "I really like my business but my only difficulty is I have no fridge for storing cold meats and yoghurts.  Before I sold cheese but with no fridge I had to stop because it would very quickly go off".  Despite this difficulty, though, Ceci is very happy and very grateful to Vision Fund and Kiva for the loan provided.  Thanks to this financial support, she will be able to realise her dream which is for her grocery store to expand and to sell everything and, laughing, she says, it's "almost, almost a corner shop".  With expansion, she can have the necessary support so her children can have a better education.  Just as Ceci has dream, so do the other members of the group.  So, they are applying for this loan to invest in their work.  Juan will invest in the greenhouse for his raspberries; Virginia  will invest in a boiled corn grinder; Raudel will invest in oil for cars; Sara will invest in clothes and finally Guillermo will use his loan for his taxi.

loans.use: to buy milk, bread, eggs, drinks, fried foods, juices and such like.

loans.name: Luis Alberto

texts.es: Luis de 49 años de edad vive en el municipio de Soledad-departamento del Atlántico-, con su cónyuge y su hija de 8 años. Allí se dedica a la fabricación de artesanías y a la confección de prendas de vestir, desde hace 12 años, aprovechando el talento en torno a las manualidades con el cual nació. Con la decisión de explotar su habilidad, Luis empezó  en esta actividad haciendo tarjetas, portapapeles, servilleteros, cuadros y todo lo que su creatividad y el buen gusto de la clientela le indicare; con este negocio le ha ido muy bien, pues poco a poco ha logrado  perfeccionarlo, hoy su meta es lograr la mejor calidad de sus productos y conseguir un mercado de exportación, por eso utiliza las redes sociales y “toca muchas puertas” para responder a este gran desafío. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará telas, hilos, pintura, madera y base de madera, pues tiene muchos pedidos y su capital de trabajo es insuficiente, para responder esta demanda, lo cual hará de su credikiva una inversión exitosa.
texts.en:
Luis, 49, lives in Soledad in the department of Atlántico with his wife and 8-year-old daughter. Using his talent and natural skills, he has been making handicrafts and clothing for 12 years. Deciding to take advantage of these skills, Luis began making cards, clipboards, napkin rings, frames, and all the things his creativity allowed and his customers' desires called for.

The business is successful, and slowly he has improved it. Today his goal is to make better quality products and export them. To meet this challenge, he is using social networks and "knocking on a lot of doors." He is applying for his first Kiva loan with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo to buy fabric, thread, paint, wood, and wood bases. He has many outstanding orders, but he lacks working capital to fill them and meet the demand that will make this Kiva investment successful.

loans.use: to buy fabric, thread, paint, wood, and wood bases.

loans.name: Monte Alto Group

texts.es:
Monte Alto es el nombre de un grupo integrado por 8 personas, la principal fuente de empleo de la zona donde viven es la siembra de caña y  la recolección de la resina de los arboles de hule.

Los integrantes del grupo son Valentina venta de abarrotes, Cornelio siembra de caña y hule, Gabriel recolección de hule, Maria Leticia venta de dulces, Maria de Jesus recolección de hule, Dionisio siembra de caña, Grisela venta de ropa y Victor siembra de caña.

Doña Valentina es una mujer muy emprendedora que desde hace mas de 10 años abrió una tienda de abarrotes en su hogar, ella decidió poner esta negocio ya que es rentable  siempre se vende ademas de que su casa esta a orilla de la carretera y los viajeros se detienen a comprar alguna galleta o refresco. 

Ella esta muy contenta con su negocio ya que gracias a el ha podido ayudar con los gastos del hogar a su esposo, Doña Valentina ademas de vender abarrotes vende pollo en pluma o destazado para obtener una ganancia mas. 

Ella invertirá este crédito en la compra de frijol, aceite, arroz, sopa, azúcar, papel higiénico, aluminio, pasta dental, shampoo, galletas, refrescos y pollo para continuar realizando sus ventas.

Ella espera en un futuro ver su negocio mas grande y surtido, para con sus ganancias tener una mejor vida y hacer unos arreglos a su hogar.

Este grupo agradece el apoyo que se le ha brindado a ella y a su grupo por medio de estos prestamos.

loans.use: to buy beans oil, rice, soup, sugar, toilet paper, tin foil, toothpaste, shampoo, biscuits, drinks and chicken.

loans.name: Quetzal Group

texts.es: Noheli es originaria de una población llamada Zitacuaro, es una chica trabajadora y con ganas de salir adelante, dice que la verdad no le gusto la escuela y por eso nada mas estudio hasta sexto de primaria, aparte de que su mama no podía con los gastos ya que las cuotas eran excesivas y por eso decidió no ir más.
