Platica que desde muy niña le ha gustado trabajar ahorita está dentro de un grupo llamado Quetzal por que ha estado pidiendo créditos para mejorar su negocio y tenerlo surtido. Platica que se dedica a la elaboración y venta de bisutería y quiere comprar con el nuevo crédito que esta pidiendo, plata, elástico, hilos, perlas, fornituras, herramientas, alicates, acero en hilo, cristales, cerámica, jade o ámbar entre otras piedras para elaborar, pulseras, collares, aretes, anillos, diademas, broches, y muchas creaciones más. Platica que su material lo compra en su población y que cuando ya tiene elaboradas la joyería sale a venderla con sus conocidas y a gente que le pague porque las vende en pagos a tres quincenas para que a la gente no se le haga pesado. Su sueño es tener un negocio grande donde pueda vender ella al mayoreo las piedras. Los demás integrantes del grupo se llaman Anastasia, Gonzalo, Maribel, Ma. del Pueblito, Maricela, Virginia, Martha Isabel, Norma Edith y María Concepción ellos están pidiendo sus créditos para invertirlos en sus negocios como elaboración y venta de antojitos mexicanos, venta de frutas y legumbres de temporada, en la compra de insumos para hacer pan para vender, para la compra de artículos para vender en tienda de abarrotes, para mantenimiento de una camioneta que hace fletes, bordado de prendas artesanales.
texts.en:
Noheli is from a populated area called Zitacuaro. She is a hard-working girl with the desire to get ahead. She says that honestly she didn't like school and that's why she only studied through the sixth grade, besides which her mom was not able to cover expenses since the fees were excessive and so she decided to stop going. She comments that from a very early age she has enjoyed working. Now she is part of a group called Quetzal, since she has been asking for loans to improve her business and keep it stocked. She says that she earns a living making and selling costume jewelry. With the new loan she is seeking she wants to buy: silver, elastic, pearled threads, settings, tools, pliers, steel wire, glass and ceramic ornaments, jade or amber among other stones for creating jewelry, bracelets, necklaces, earrings, rings, diadems, hair clips and many other created items. 

She says that she purchases materials in her area and when she has the jewelry made she goes out to sell it among her acquaintances and to people who pay her because she sells to them on credit, three payments over six weeks, so that it's not so onerous for people to buy. Her dream is to have a large business where she could sell the stones wholesale. 

The other group members are named Anastasia, Gonzaol, Maribel, Maria del Pueblito, Maricela, Virginia, Martha Isabel, Norma Edith and Maria Concepcion. They are requesting loans to invest in their businesses such as preparation and sales of Mexican finger foods, seasonal produce sales, to purchase supplies for making bread to sell, to purchase items to sell at a grocery store, to maintain a truck used for transport, and embroidering handcrafted clothing items.

loans.use: to purchase silver, elastic, pearled threads, settings, tools, piers, steel wire, glass, ceramic, jade or amber among other stones for creating jewelry, bracelets, necklaces, earrings, rings, diadems, hair clips and many other created items.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en: Fatuma, age 44, is a merchant who sells clothes. She is single, lives in Tiribe, Mombasa, Kenya. She began selling in the marketplace thanks to financial assistance from her parents, who are also merchants. Gradually she was able to expand her business and now she offers her products throughout the district.  She is requesting assistance of a loan amounting to ksh.50,000 so that she can buy articles of clothing that are in season.

loans.use: to buy articles of clothing that are in season.

loans.name: Luka

texts.en:
Luka is 39 years old and a businessman. He is still running his retail and ice cream outlet wholesale shop for the past six years with support from his wife Mary. His monthly income has increased to KES 30,000 which he uses to support his family. 

Luka is applying for his third loan from KADET LTD, which he intends to use to open another ice cream outlet because of increased clientele.

With the anticipated profit from the business he will improve the living standard of his family and educate his children. His hopes and dreams are to give his family the best education.

loans.use: To open another ice cream outlet

loans.name: Tumaini Group

texts.en:
Tumaini is a group of 14 farmers in Bungoma South District represented by Robert. The group has 11 women and 3 men. Robert is on the right of the photo with his hand raised. Farming inputs will be delivered to him on credit, consisting of the necessary materials to plant ½ an acre of maize, millet and sorghum. Robert is a new One Acre Fund farmer and is excited about the 2013 Long Rains season. He joined One Acre Fund in order to access the best input prices, grow enough food for the family, and use increased profits to send his children to school.


Robert managed to harvest 5.5 bags of maize on 1 acre of land last year. As a One Acre Fund farmer, he hopes to harvest even more. He hopes that his profits from the 2013 Long Rains season can be used to send his children to school, invest in buying a new cow, and perhaps invest in another business.

During the 2013 Long Rains season, each group member will receive ½ an acre of agricultural inputs on credit. Robert’s group will receive 7 acres worth of inputs on credit.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize, millet, and sorghum.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more grocery items to sell

loans.name: Basilia

texts.en:
Basilia works hard to support eight children. She is married and has a buy and sell charcoal business in the Philippines.

Basilia requested a PHP 1,650 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy a solar lamp. She is getting the solar lamp because she wants to have backup light, in case of emergency.

Basilia is aware that by using the solar lamp, she is not only saving money, she is also helping the environment and reducing health and hazard risks to her family.

loans.use: to buy a solar lamp.

loans.name: Charrie

texts.en:
Charrie is 39 years old and married with one child who is in school. She works very hard to provide for her family.

Charrie runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stock to sell like soap, noodles, canned goods, etc.

Charrie has been in this business for two years.

In the future Charrie would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stock to sell like soap, noodles and canned goods.

loans.name: Las Nenas Group

texts.es: Ninfa tiene 26 años, desde jovencita le ha gustado trabajar y hace 3 años abrió una tienda de abarrotes en su casa ya que antes le ayudaba a su esposo con los gastos del hogar, platica que empezó con una mesita con dulces y como le va bien porque cerca de su casa se hay una secundaria y una primaria decidió meter un poco mas de productos como refrescos, jugos y sandwiches que ella prepara. Con el tiempo, poco a poco se ha superado y tiene ahora una tienda de abarrotes, actualmente es madre soltera de dos niños (se separó) y dice que le está echando ganas para sacar adelante a sus hijos, ahorita está pidiendo un crédito para surtir su tienda de abarrotes e ira a surtir sus productos en una tienda donde vende a mas bajos costos los productos no perecederos. Dice que su sueño es hacer crecer su tienda y tener unas maquinitas para que los niños de su comunidad se diviertan. Ella pertenece a un grupo llamado Las Nenas y dice que  le pusieron así que por que sus compañeras y ella son mujeres muy alegres y se sienten jóvenes. Las demás integrantes del grupo se llaman Rosalba, María del Rosario, Alicia, Rosa, Lizbeth, María Minerva, Gloria, Alicia, Celia, Claudia Minerva, Ma. Beatriz, Ma. Concepción y Jenifer ellas invertirán sus créditos en la compra de cerdos para hacerlos en carnitas y venderlos en tacos, venta de zapatos, venta de perfumes, cosméticos por catalogo, venta colchas por catalogo, insumos para vender tacos al pastor, compra de semillas para tostarlas y vender y para la compra de insumos para hacer repostería y venderla.
texts.en:
Ninfa is 26 and has enjoyed working since she was very young. Three years ago, she opened a grocery store in her house so that she could help her husband meet household expenses. She started with a small table of sweets, which was successful because there is a high school and elementary school nearby. She added more items such as sodas, juices, and homemade sandwiches. Slowly, the business grew, and now she has a grocery store. She is the single mother of two children (she is separated), and she wants to help her children get ahead.

She is applying for a loan to stock her store and will also sell to another store where nonperishable items are sold at discount prices. She dreams of expanding her store and having arcade machines the local children can play. 

She belongs to the communal bank Las Nenas, which she joined because the women members were pleasant and young-at-heart. The other members are Rosalba, María del Rosario, Alicia, Rosa, Lizbeth, María Minerva, Gloria, Alicia, Celia, Claudia Minerva, Ma. Beatriz, Ma. Concepción, and Jenifer. They will use the loan to buy pigs to slaughter for taco fillings; to sell shoes; to sell catalog perfumes and cosmetics; to sell catalog mattresses; to buy ingredients to make tacos; to buy seeds to roast and sell; and to buy supplies to make baked goods to sell.

loans.use: to buy stock for her grocery store like milk, eggs, ham, bleach, tuna, sugar, and more.

loans.name: Ana Cristina

texts.es:
Ana tiene 34 años, no está casada pero si tiene un hijo de 10 años. Ella empezó con su negocio de ventas de artículos vendiendo a sus familiares juguetes y artículos de cocina, poco a poco comenzó a tener ingresos para poder mantenerse ella y su hijo, por la que continúo con su negocio vendiendo artículos para el hogar a  amigos y a recomendados de clientes. 

En la actualidad vende sabanas a $ 25.00, edredones a $ 35.00, entre otros artículos. Los cuales tiene una estrategia de ventas que es vender a crédito, en donde ella entrega el producto a su cliente lo registra si le da a crédito y le da plazo para que pague diariamente de $ 1 a $ 2 , así el cliente que no tiene como pagar al contado, ella le da tiempo para que pague el producto. Es así como se capitaliza para comprar más productos. 
Ana tiene muchas aspiraciones con su negocio por eso quiere continuar con sus ventas, por tal quiere el préstamo para comprar sabanas, edredones, artículos para el hogar. 

En la entrevista las palabras que expreso Ana fueron las siguientes: 
Quiero tener una bella casa para poder tener un local comercial en una parte de la casa, y así darles trabajo a otras personas que lo necesitan. También quisiera darle a mi familia lo que necesita económicamente y estar siempre unidos con mi familia como lo estamos actualmente.
texts.en:
Ana, age 34, is not married, but she has a ten year old child.  She started with her sales business by selling toys and kitchen items to her relatives.  Little by little, she started to get income to be able to support herself and her child.  Therefore, she continued with her business of selling household items to friends and referred customers.

She now sells sheets for $25.00, eiderdowns for $35.00, and other items.  She has a sales strategy for them, which is to sell on credit.  She gives the customer a payment plan so that they pay between $1 and $2 daily.  That way she gives the customer who does not have a way of paying in cash time to pay for the product.  This is how she capitalized in order to buy more products.

Ana has a lot of aspirations for her business.  Therefore, she wants to continue with her business.  She wants the loan to buy sheets, eiderdowns, and household items.

During the interview Ana expressed the following:

“I want to have a very nice house in order to have a commercial spot in part of the house.  I want to give work to other people who need it.  Also, I would like to give my family what they financially need.  I want to always be as connected with my family as we are now.”

loans.use: to buy sheets, eiderdowns, and household items.

loans.name: Ciro Enrique

texts.es:
Ciro de 51 años, tiene dos hijos y está separado de su esposa actualmente. El es vendedor de periódicos de los más populares en Guayaquil llamados “El universo”, “La extra” y la lotería en el centro de la Ciudad hace 10 años atrás. Trabaja desde las 06:00am hasta las 11:00am.

Una de las dificultades de vender los periódicos debido a su discapacidad la cual es que no tiene sus dos brazos, esta discapacidad el la obtuvo trabajando aproximadamente hace unos 20 años atrás cuando él trabajaba de fierrero en una empresa y recibió una descarga eléctrica y los doctores para evitar que la cangrena  llegue al corazón tuvieron que cortarle los brazos y eso hace que no pueda trabajar con la normalidad de cualquier persona. Pero a pesar de su discapacidad el sigue trabajando para poder darle lo mejor a sus dos hijos. 

El también tiene en su casa para mejorar sus ingresos dos departamentos que alquila ya que hace años a él le heredaron una casa y aprovecho la oportubidad para poder construir y asi alquilar esos espacios, uno de los departamentos los alquila mensualmente a $ 75 y otro a $ 130. Tiene muchas aspiraciones de continuar con su negocio y el alquiler de los departamentos por eso el quiere el préstamo para centrarlo en mejorar los departamentos que alquilar y así tener un mejor precio para tener mas ingresos, por lo cual él quiere comprar pinturas, cemento, bloques para el arreglo de los mismos. 

En la entrevista el Ciro nos dijo: 
Mis proyecciones para largo plazo es darles una buena educación a mis hijos y mejorar su vivienda para poder tener mas ingresos muy aparte de la venta de periódicos.
texts.en:
Ciro, 51, has 2 children and is currently separated from his wife.  He's had a business selling the most popular newspapers in Guayaquil, such as “El universo," and  “La extra," and lottery tickets in the center of the city for 10 years.  He works from 6am until 11am.  

One of the difficulties he faces in selling newspapers is that he has a disability.  He lost both arms in a work accident 20 years ago.  He was working as a metalworker for a company when he was injured by an electric shock, and the doctors had to remove his arms to prevent gangrene from reaching his heart.  This has made it difficult for him to do normal work like other people.  However, in spite of his disability, he continues to work so that he can provide the best for his two children.

In order to generate more income he also has 2 apartments in his house that he rents out, because years ago he inherited a house and took advantage of the opportunity to build and rent out these spaces.  One of the apartments rents monthly for $75, the other for $130.  Ciro has a lot of aspirations for his business and his apartment rentals, and for this reason, he wants to take a loan so that he can make some improvements to the apartments.  This way he can charge more rent and obtain more income.  To do this, he wants to buy paint, cement, and cement blocks for the repairs to the apartments.  

In the interview, Ciro told us, "My plans for the long term are to provide my children with a good education, and improve my house so that I can have more income that is independent from my business selling newspapers."

loans.use: to buy paint, cement, and cement blocks to improve the apartments that he rents

loans.name: Antonieta

texts.en:
Antonieta works hard to support six children. She is married and has a fish vending business in the Philippines.

Antonieta requested a PHP 7500 loan through NWTF to buy a SOLAR LAMP. She is getting the solar lamp because she wants to save money by minimizing her kerosene expenses.

Antonieta is aware that by using the solar lamp, she is not only saving money, she is also helping the environment and reducing health and hazard risks to her family.

loans.use: to purchase a solar lamp

loans.name: Geofrey

texts.en:
Geofrey is a married man who has three children. He describes himself as hardworking, polite and obedient. 

Geofrey operates a butcher store where he sells meat. His primary customers are local residents. He describes his biggest business challenge as insufficient funds for improving the business. 

He will use the KES 5,800 loan to buy a solar lantern that will be used by his five family members. His business goal is to expand his business within five years. 

This is his third loan with SMEP DTM after taking a loan of KES 45,000.

loans.use: to buy a solar lantern.

loans.name: Yuya Group

texts.en:
Dishon’s group, called Yuya Group, has 12 farmers and is located in Bungoma South District. Dishon is pictured on the right of Yuya Group, with his hand raised. Dishon is pictured amongst the seven men and five women of his group. 

He will receive input loans capable of planting 0.5 acres with sorghum, millet, and maize. The 2013 Long Rains season will be Dishon’s first season with One Acre Fund. He joined this year in order to gain access to hybrid seed and fertilizer and to use increased profits to send his children to school.

Dishon thought his harvest last year was poor. He hopes that, as a One Acre Fund farmer, he can have an excellent harvest. He plans on using future profits from the harvest to send his children to school, repair his home, and save for the future. 

For the 2013 Long Rains season, Yuya Group members will take input loans of 0.5 acres each. In total, this group will receive input loans for use on six acres of land.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize, millet, and sorghum.

loans.name: Yugabet

texts.en:
Yugabet is a married business lady living in Mombassa area, Kenya. She is a fish seller, a business she has run for three years. She employs three people in her business. Yugabet is also formally employed.

She is applying for a loan of 52,250 Kenya shillings to buy raw fish and install working facilities. The challenge is logistical problems e.g. transport since she gets the fish from over 1,000 kilometres away from her location. 

Yugabet’s desire is for the business to grow to a level where there will be many customers and be a dealer in other marine products. She believes that this will help her provide for her family’s needs.

loans.use: To buy raw fish and install working facilities.

loans.name: Angelina

texts.en:
Angelina is a 57-year-old married woman from Talibon, Bohol. She is engaged in a hog-raising business. She raises hogs. She has been in the hog-raising business for almost a year. She earns 6,000 PHP a month by doing the hog-raising. 

Due to lack of capital to sustain her business, Angelina requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to buy feed for the pigs to grow healthily so she will be able to sell them on time. In the future, Angelina would like to expand her business to achieve a sustainable livelihood.

loans.use: to buy feed for the pigs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase bee hives and pay for their colonization.

loans.name: Maren

texts.en:
Maren is 48 years old, married to Kiteleki and blessed with seven children that are between the age of two and 20 years old. He has been a wheat farmer for the last 20 years earning an income of KES 55,000 monthly.

He is servicing his sixth loan of KES 100,000 from KADET Ltd. that will allow him to prepare the land and buy farm inputs to help get better yields

He intends to use to use the anticipated profits to support the business and provide for basic family needs. His future dreams is to be financially stable

loans.use: to prepare the land and buy farm inputs to help get better yields.

loans.name: Sikata Group

texts.en:
Christine is a member of Sikata Group in Bungoma South District. She is pictured with 12 One Acre Fund farmers, eight women and four men. Christine is standing on the right with her hand raised. She is receiving an input loan for ½ an acre of maize, millet and sorghum cultivation. The 2013 Long Rains season will be Christine’s first season with One Acre Fund. She joined this year in order to use increased profits to send her children to school and to gain access to hybrid seed and fertilizer.

Last year, Christine harvested eight bags of maize on one acre of land. She is excited to improve her harvest as a One Acre Fund farmer during the 2013 Long Rains season. She plans to use the money that she earns from her next harvest to send her children to school and perhaps invest in another business. For the 2013 Long Rains season, Christine’s group members will take input loans of ½ an acre each. In total, this group will receive input loans for use on 6 acres of land.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize, millet, and sorghum.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy grocery items for a grocery selling business.

loans.name: Macrina

texts.en:
Macrina is 33 years old and has three children, who are in school. She is in the agricultural business, pig fattening, in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 20,500 loan through NWTF to buy additional feed and vitamins for her piglets. Macrina has been pig fattening for 10 years, and she has borrowed 13 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her activity.

Macrina would like to save enough money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional feed and vitamins for her piglets

loans.name: Hope

texts.en:
Hope is a 67-year-old poultry farmer in Voi, Kenya. She is a married mother who supports seven grown-up children and twelve grandchildren. She has been in this business for the past thirteen years, and she has done well. Her monthly income is great. 

She is requesting her third loan from KADET LTD to purchase one-day-old broiler chicks and their feed. She will use the anticipated profit to expand her poultry farm, more and more. She hopes to be a chicken meat supplier in Voi, in the future.

loans.use: to purchase one-day-old broiler chicks, and their feed.

loans.name: Sancha

texts.en:
Sancha is 35 years old and she is now applying for a loan of USD 1,000 to improve her business. She opened her kiosk in 2000 with her own working capital. She earns a good income from her business.

She will use her loan to buy some stocks to keep in her store, such as Sprite, salt, soft drinks, beer, noodles, and rice. She is a very hard-working woman and doing business has become her regular activity for the past 12 years. She wants to make her business bigger and improve her living conditions in the future.

loans.use: To buy items for her store, such as soft drinks, beer, salt, noodles, and rice.

loans.name: Maria  Auxiliadora

texts.es:
María es una mujer de 57 años, no tuvo ningún nivel de instrucción por la escasez de recursos en su hogar, se casó siendo muy joven con Felipe que ahora tiene 63 años y se dedica por cuenta propia a la agricultura, ya no tienen hijos a cargo, pues todos son adultos e independientes. María nació en Chone pero desde hace muchos años vive en el Cantón Santo Domingo de la Provincia de Santo Domingo de los Tsachilas. Santo Domingo se encuentra conectando la Región Sierra con la Región Costa del Ecuador, es una ciudad que se ha convertido en un eje comercial con varios sectores en crecimiento y como prueba se tiene a varias familias emprendedoras que hace algunos años comenzaron con pequeños negocios y ahora son microempresarios que aportan a la generación de empleo. Los estudios revelan que todos los negocios en su mayoría, empezaron empíricamente y han tenido acogida por el paso de turistas, empresarios y viajeros que se trasladan de una región a otra y además que es la tercera ciudad más habitada en el país. María reside en la Parroquia Puerto Limón de este cantón, un sector que fue habitado por una comunidad tsáchila y tiene varios atractivos turísticos, aunque está muy alejado de la ciudad. Además los habitantes de esta parroquia en su gran mayoría, se dedican a la agricultura y ganadería.
Hace 3 años María solo se dedicaba a los quehaceres domésticos, sin embargo, nació en ella la preocupación por su futuro y los años de vejez, por lo que decidió aportar también con el sustento para su hogar vendiendo cerdos y pollos, actividad de la que está pendiente en la mañana y en la tarde y a veces en las noches cuando hay que tener especiales cuidados por las condiciones climáticas. Ahora apostó por si primer crédito el cual lo utilizará en la compra de balanceado e insumos para que sus animales tengan la dieta y los cuidados adecuados que les permite crecer sanos y robustos lo que les hace más apetecibles en el mercado. María ha intentado obtener créditos en varias instituciones y Bancos que lamentablemente se han negado a otorgar el dinero por la dificultad para ir a visitar al cliente a la zona rural bastante alejada en donde vive. Pese a esto María siguió luchando incansable y gracias a la intervención de Kiva en Fundación Alternativa, está feliz porque puede dar el primer paso al crecimiento de su negocio y así mantener un ahorro para casos fortuitos que puedan presentarse en su vejez o en la de su esposo.
texts.en:
María is a 57-year-old woman. She had no schooling because of the scarcity of resources in her home. She got married when she was very young to Felipe who is now 63 and who works for himself in farming. They no longer have dependents since all their children are grown and independent. María was born in Chone but many years ago went to live the Santo Domingo hamlet of the province of Santo Domingo de los Tsachilas. Santo Domingo connects the Sierra Region with the Coastal Region of Ecuador. The city has become a commercial corridor with a number of growing industries, and as proof, there are various entrepreneurial families who some years ago began their own businesses and now are micro-business owners who help generate employment. Studies reveal that the majority of the businesses began out of hands-on experience and have caught on due to the travel of tourists, business persons and travelers from region to region; furthermore, it is the third-most inhabited city in the country. María resides in the Puerto Limón Parish of this hamlet, a place which was inhabited by a tsáchila community and has a number of tourist attractions although it is quite far from the city. In addition, the great majority of the inhabitants of this parish work in crop farming and animal husbandry. 

Three years ago María was devoting herself solely to household tasks. However, concern for her future in later years took hold in her, and so she decided to contribute also to the sustenance of her home selling pigs and chickens, an activity she she tends to in the mornings, afternoons and sometimes at night when special precautions must be taken on account of weather conditions. Now she has applied for her first loan which will be used to purchase commercial feed and supplies so her animals may have the diet and necessary care that would allow them to grow healthy and strong, which makes them more desirable in the marketplace. María has tried to take out loans at various institutions and banks where unfortunately they have refused to grant the money, owing to the difficulty in visiting the client in the highly isolated rural area where she lives. Nevertheless María kept on fighting tirelessly and, thanks to the involvement of Kiva with Fundación Alternativa, she is happy because she can take the first step towards growing her business and so maintain some savings against chance events that might arise in her and her husband's old age.

loans.use: to purchase commercial feed and supplies for raising her animals.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice is 54 years old, married to Charles, and blessed with two children that she supports. She has been growing tomatoes for the last five years and selling the produce to her customers who normally buy wholesale. Her monthly income is KES 40,000. 

She has applied for her fifth loan of KES 50,000 from KADET LTD, to purchase fertilizers, pesticides, and tomato seedlings for better crop yields.

The anticipated profits will be used to support the business. Her future dream is to have a stable business.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers, pesticides and tomato seedlings.

loans.name: Yetana Group

texts.en:
Emily is pictured on the right with her hand raised amongst her Yetana Group members. The 14 of them, 10 women and 4 men, are farmers in Bungoma South District. Farming inputs will be delivered to her on credit consisting of the necessary materials to plant ½ an acre of maize, millet and sorghum. 

Emily first enrolled with One Acre Fund during the 2010 Long Rains and is now preparing to be a One Acre Fund farmer during the 2013 Long Rains season. Emily joined One Acre Fund in order to grow enough food for the family and use increased profits to send her children to school.


Prior to joining One Acre Fund, Emily was only able to harvest 4 bags of maize per ½ acre, but during the Long Rains 2012, she was able to harvest 6 bags per ½ an acre. She plans on using future profits from the harvest to send her children to school and repair her home. Emily’s group members will each receive input loans of ½ an acre during the 2013 Long Rains season. In total they will receive inputs for 7 acres of maize and sorghum.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize, millet, and sorghum.

loans.name: Halima

texts.en:
Halima is a long-standing client of Yehu microfinance. She is married and has two children, and she lives in Tiribe, Mombasa, Kenya. She is a hardworking lady who owns a dried fish business, where she buys in large quantities and resells in small quantities at a higher price, as it is in retail.
 
Halima is a person who has a desire to make progress and get ahead in life. She always works hard so that she can provide her family with everything they need. Her dream is to have large business premises. She is requesting this loan to buy more dried fish, so that she can continue working towards her dreams. She is grateful for the opportunity that is being given to her once again, as she would like to continue growing her business.

loans.use: to buy more dried fish in large quantity, to resell at retail in small quantities

loans.name: Upendo Group

texts.en:
Upendo Group is located in Bungoma South District. It is a group of seven women and four men, led by Scolastica, who is pictured on the right with her hand raised. She is receiving an input loan for ½ acre of maize, millet and sorghum cultivation. Scolastica first enrolled with One Acre Fund during the 2008 Long Rains, and now she is preparing to be a One Acre Fund farmer during the 2013 Long Rains season. Scolastica joined One Acre Fund in order to gain access to hybrid seed and fertilizer, and to get the best input prices.

Scolastica described her last year's harvest as good, but she believes she can have an even better one this year. She plans to use the money that she earns from her next harvest to send her children to school, and to save for the future. For the 2013 Long Rains season, Scolastica’s group members will take input loans of ½ acre each. In total, this group will receive input loans for use on 5.5 acres of land.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize, millet, and sorghum.

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Marilou is 42 years old and single. Marilou works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 21,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase additional stocks to sell, such as snack foods, spices, canned goods, noodles, and eggs.

Marilou has borrowed and paid seven loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for five years and also earns an income from a buy and sell, ready-to-wear clothing business.

Marilou aspires to save and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks to sell, such as snack foods, spices, canned goods, noodles, and eggs.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is 52 years old, a married woman who has five children. She is involved in selling charcoal. She has seven years of experience in this field. 

This is Fatuma's first loan. She wants to use this loan to increase her goods turnover and buy more sacks of charcoal to sell. Fatuma expresses her gratitude to Yehu and Kiva lenders for their financial support.

loans.use: to buy more sacks of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Arvelodi

texts.en:
Arvelodi lives in the small town of Rustavi. He is 64 years old and a pensioner. He lives with his wife and 12-year-old grandchild. Arvelodi is, at the moment, unemployed. The only source of income for the family is the monthly retirement pensions of Arvelodi and his wife. The family lives in poverty. According to Credo estimations, they belong to the 'vulnerable poor' category.

Arvelodi used to work as a taxi driver with his own car, but his business was stopped because of financial problems. Arvelodi sold his car, but now he decided to restart his business, because their existing income isn’t enough for the family and their living conditions are poor. His loan request was approved as part of a new joint initiative between Kiva and Credo. This start-up loan programme aims to provide business start-up and restart-up loans with more favourable conditions to rural poor people, who do not have access to standard credit, being regarded as 'high-risk borrowers' because of their low income.

Arvelodi purchased a different car, but he needs money to pay the toll for it. After the tax is paid he will offer a service to local people as a taxi driver. The income of the family will increase, and they will be able to improve their living conditions. The family will also have enough income to use the usual sources of credit in the country, in case of need.

loans.use: to pay the tax for his car, so he will be able to begin using it to provide taxi services

loans.name: Fundadores De Fe Group

texts.es:
Este BC se llama “Fundadores de FE” lo constituyen 18 emprendedores quienes tienen como principal rubro el turismo, tales como hospedajes, alimentación, artesanía entre otros, todos pertenecen a la ciudad de Pucón.
Yesica Soto, quien en la foto aparece de pie, la primera de derecha a izquierda, luciendo un sombrero mexicano; ofrece el servicio de festejos de cumpleaños, arrienda un local en pleno centro, la cual lo tiene ornamentado para los eventos, fabrica piñatas, coronas, adornos,; además comercializa juguetes en el mismo local.  Se dedica a este rubro desde hace un año y medio; teniendo eventos todos los fines de semana en la temporada de otoño e invierno. 
Yesica invirtió su crédito en mano de obra y materiales para hacer cotillón.
Su sueño es ampliar su rubro a nivel nacional, ya que nos cuenta que por su zona no existe otro servicio como el que ella ofrece. Tiene clientes de otras comunas, por lo cual esta motivada a salir adelante y crecer como empresaria y persona. Es soltera y vive con sus padres 
Por último nos cuenta que le ha sido de mucha ayuda  trabajar con Fondo Esperanza, lo que más le gusta son los cursos que ha realizado y recibe apoyo y motivaciones por parte de Fondo Esperanza.
Pucón es una  ciudad al sur de Chile, ubicada en la región de La Araucanía. Es una ciudad pequeña, pero cuenta con todos los servicios básicos y turísticos, siendo uno de los principales centros de servicios del área cordillerana y principal centro turístico de la región, junto con Villarrica. Durante los meses de verano se realizan numerosas actividades y eventos culturales, artísticos y deportivos, Además de las innumerables alternativas de Ecoturismo, Turismo Aventura y Etnoturismo.
texts.en:
This communal bank is called “Fundadores de FE” and is made up of 18 entrepreneurs who work in tourism areas such as hospitality, food, arts and crafts, and other things.  All of them live in Pucón.

Yesica Soto, who is standing to the left in the photograph, wearing a Mexican hat, offers birthday party services.  She rents an establishment downtown where she makes piñatas, crowns, and decorations.  She also sells toys from the same location.  She’s been doing this for a year and a half and has events every weekend in the fall and summer.

Yesica used her loan to pay for labor and supplies to make party favors.

She also tells us that working with Fondo Esperanza has been a great help.  What she likes the most are the courses she took and that she receives help and encouragement.  Pucón is a community in southern Chile, located in the La Araucanía region.  It’s a small town and has all the basic services and tourism.  It’s one of the main mountainous centers in the area and a main tourist center in the region, along with Villarrica.  During the summer months they host various cultural, art, and sporting events.  There are also many ecotourism, adventure tourism, and ethnic tourism.

loans.use: to buy supplies.

loans.name: Umoja B Group

texts.en:
Anne is a member of Umoja B Group, in Bungoma South District. She is pictured with 17 One Acre Fund farmers, 12 women and 5 men. Anne is standing on the right, with her hand raised. She is receiving an input loan for ½ an acre of maize, millet and sorghum cultivation. Anne joined One Acre Fund during the Long Rains season of 2010, and now she is enrolling in the Long Rains 2013 season. Anne joined One Acre Fund so that she could gain access to hybrid seed and fertilizer, and use her increased profit to send her children to school.

Anne described her last year's harvest as poor, but she believes she can have a better one this year. She hopes that her profit from the 2013 Long Rains season can be used to purchase a piece of land and invest in livestock.

During the 2013 Long Rains season, each group member will receive ½ an acre of agricultural inputs on credit. Anne’s group will receive 8.5 acres worth of inputs on credit.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize, millet, and sorghum.

loans.name: Selim

texts.en:
Selim is a married man, aged 27 years and blessed with two children, aged four and two years.  He offers motorcycle transportation services in Kapsabet. He has been in operation for a period of four years, earning an income of KES 14,000.

He has joined KADET LTD through a self-help group. Now he is seeking a first loan of KES 30,000. He intends to use this amount to purchase a dairy cow, which will be a secondary source of income for him.  

The profits he earns will be used to expand his motorcycle business and purchase another motorbike.  He hopes for prosperity in his business and to educate his children to greater levels.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow, to have a second source of income.

loans.name: Zurab

texts.en:
Zurab is 42 years old. He lives in Akhmeta District with his wife, Soso, and his 72-year-old father-in-law. Zurab requested a loan from local financial institutions several times, for a family business start-up, but without any success. His loan request was rejected every time, because of low income and the family’s poor living conditions. 

The only source of income for the family is trading in used clothing. His wife buys used clothing from the wholesalers, and sells at a higher price. It is hardly enough to have food for the family. According to Credo estimations, the family belongs to the subsistence poor category. 

Zurab requested a loan from Credo to start a family business. His loan request was approved, in the frame of a new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The Start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and restart-up credits, with soft conditions, to Georgia's poor people, who do not qualify for regular credit products, being regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of low income.

With the received credit, Zurab will purchase a natural gas apparatus for his car. He plans to serve local people as a taxi driver. Because other kinds of fuel cost much more, Zurab prefers to decrease his costs by adapting his car to run on natural gas. The new taxi business will increase the income of the family. The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva Start-up loan, will significantly improve the living conditions of the family.

loans.use: to pay for having his car adapted to run on natural gas instead of petrol, reducing his costs.

loans.name: Bebelyn

texts.en:
Bebelyn is a 37-year-old, married woman from Talibon, Bohol. She has four children. The oldest child is 15, while the youngest is 6 years old. Bebelyn raises pigs. She has been in the hog-raising business for five years. Her husband is a driver. She earns 6,000 PHP a month by doing the hog-raising.

Bebelyn requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to buy feed and supplements for pigs. Bebelyn would like to expand her business in the future, to support her family and to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy feed and nutritional supplements for her pigs.

loans.name: Lisset

texts.es: Lisset  de 38 años de edad vive en el municipio de Malambo, donde tiene una tienda de víveres, ranchos y refrescos  desde hace 10 años, cuando ahorraron compraron un lote y lo adecuaron para instalar su negocio, mediante el cual ella realiza sus ventas todos los días desde las 7 de la mañana hasta las 9 de la noche, usando  unidades de medidas, que responden a la demanda de su clientela que compra en pequeñas cantidades, de acuerdo a sus posibilidades económicas, en una frecuencia diaria. Para Lisset que su tienda tenga un buen surtido y atender con excelencia a su clientela se ha convertido en su meta principal, porque quiere que su negocio sea la mejor tienda del sector, pero su gran desafío es no tener el suficiente capital de trabajo para lograrlo;  esta es la razón por la cual acude a un credikiva, con el cual comprará enlatados, víveres, refrescos tubérculos, verduras etc. Su credikiva proyecta ser una buena inversión, pues ella comprará los artículos de mayor rotación para tener siempre inventarios que la ayuden a consolidarse, porque allí su clientela satisface sus necesidades, deseos e intereses de consumo.
texts.en:
Lisset  is 38 years old and lives in the municipality of Malambo where she has store selling basic goods, meals and refreshments for ten years. They saved and bought a plot of land to set up their business. She works here everyday making sales from 7 am until 9 pm to sell to her customers in small quantities using her measuring units. On a daily basis she does what she can with the economic opportunities.

Lisset's main goal has become to have a well stocked store with excellent customer service. She wants her business to be the best store in the area. Her greatest challenge has been not having enough capital to achieve her goal. This is her reason for requesting a Kiva loan, with which she will buy canned goods, basic needs, refreshments, tubers, vegetables, etc. She projects that her loan will be a good investment because she will buy goods that are always in demand so that she is always well stocked, helping her to consolidate. Here, her clients satisfy their needs, desires and consumption habits.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, basic needs, refreshments, tubers, vegetables, etc.

loans.name: Abubakar

texts.en:
Abubakar is now 37 years old. His shop has grown tremendously and he is requesting his fourth loan to purchase more varieties of stock ranging from food stuffs and non-food items such as motorcycle spare parts for easy access by the riders in the area. 

He plans to diversify his retail business more and more with the anticipated profit and make it a one-stop shop. He hopes to grow bigger in the future.

loans.use: to purchase cooking oil, washing powders, maize flour and rice as well as non-food items.

loans.name: Kasyula

texts.en:
Kasyula, 32, is married, has three children and lives with them in Mwambalazi, province of Coast. She sells fruits and vegetables for a living and also does farming.
She is requesting a loan to buy fruits and vegetables, such as pineapples, bananas, kale, onions, cabbage, and oranges. Her goal is to have several businesses. The challenge she is up against is the high price of the products.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables, such as pineapples, bananas, kale, onions, cabbage, and oranges.

loans.name: Jikaze Group

texts.en:
Jikaze is a group of 15 farmers in Bungoma South District and is represented by Dorise. The group has 11 women and four men. Dorise is on the right of the photo with her hand raised. Farming inputs will be delivered to her on credit consisting of the necessary materials to plant ½ an acre of maize, millet and sorghum. Dorise first enrolled with One Acre Fund during the 2011 Long Rains and is now preparing to be a One Acre Fund farmer during the 2013 Long Rains season. Dorice joined One Acre Fund in order to grow enough food for the family and to access the best input prices. 


Dorise described her harvest as poor last year, but believes she can have a better one this year. She plans on using future profits from the harvest to send her children to school and repair her home. Dorise’s group members will each receive input loans of ½ an acre during the 2013 Long Rains season. In total they will receive inputs for 7.5 acres of maize, millet and sorghum.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize, millet, and sorghum.

loans.name: Mwanaisha

texts.en:
Mwanaisha is from the city of mombasa. She is married with five children and works as a merchant. She has been the owner of a food store for two years. She is making headway with the business having attracted a good number of customers who appreciate her very well-stocked store. She is a very enthusiastic person who wants to keep growing and investing in her business so that she can help with the household expenses and continue to improve her business over time.

She is requesting a loan to invest in drinks, dairy products, bread, vegetables and other merchandise. This way, she can continue to provide customers with a good variety of products and also attract new customers. She is requesting a loan of 50,000 KES and it is projected to be enough to restock her business.

loans.use: to invest in drinks, dairy products, bread, vegetables

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce has paid off her previous loan successfully and now has embarked on a tomato farming business. She has managed to work a large portion of her farm using proceeds from the previous loan.

She has requested another loan from KADET LTD to buy farm supplies and pay for labor. She plans to diversify her farm, growing fruits in the future.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies like manure, seeds and insecticides and pay for labor.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a 29-year-old married man living with his wife and only one child.  After gaining many years of experience in his present occupation, he was able to open his own barbershop almost five years ago. He also got his wife’s support, especially after facing bad financial situations. She works in a travel agency. 

Due to his good business reputation, he was capable of building up a clientele of a good number of loyal customers. With his requested youth loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l, he will purchase shaving equipment and supplies, in addition to renovating his shop’s interior. In that way, he will satisfy his customers' demand and serve them with excellence. He is positive about his business prospects and plans to open a new branch of his shop in the coming years.

loans.use: to purchase shaving equipment and supplies in addition to renovating his shop’s interior.

loans.name: Ricardo

texts.es: Ricardo tiene 58 años de edad y se dedica a la distribución de carne de res, desde hace 5 años. Su negocio fue trasmitido de generación en generación, pues toda su familia se ha dedicado a esa actividad; sus principales clientes son las tiendas, a quienes vende toda clase  de carne, molida, hígado, costillas etc. El diariamente  inicia su jornada,  desde las 4 de la mañana hasta las 12 del dia y de lunes a sábado. Su principal proveedor es el matadero mas importante de la región, a quien le compra a crédito y de contado, para vender su producto  de contado. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el cual comprará en mayor volumen, carne de res, para continuar con su propósito de ampliar la base de clientes y finalmente ganar más, para ayudar a sus nietos en el logro de estudios con calidad.
texts.en: Ricardo is 58 years old and has been a butcher for 5 years. His business has been passed down from generation to generation and his whole family works in the business. His main clients are stores to whom he sells all types of meat, such as ground meat, liver, ribs, etc.  He starts his day at 4 in the morning and works until noon, Monday through Saturday. His main provider is the most important slaughterhouse in the region where he buys on credit as well as cash and then turns around and sells his products for cash. He is currently applying for a Kiva loan, his first through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. With his loan he will buy larger quantities of beef so that he can keep building his client base and eventually earn more so he can help provide quality education for his grandchildren.

loans.use: purchase a larger quantities of beef.

loans.name: Argie

texts.en:
Argie is a 28-year-old, married woman from Talibon, Bohol. A mother of a one-year-old daughter, Argie operates a retail store in the community. She sells basic commodities, like pouch vinegar, soy sauce, sugar, soaps, spices, canned goods, and noodles. She has been in the retail business for three years.

Argie requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to purchase additional merchandise, such as soft drinks and rice. Argie would like to invest in other business  ventures to support the needs of her growing child, at the same time, saving for her child's future education.

loans.use: to purchase additional merchandise for her store, such as soft drinks and rice.

loans.name: Jaime Alberto

texts.es: Jaime de 42 años de edad, vive al suroccidente de la ciudad con su cónyuge y su hijo en la edad de 14 años. Él trabaja en una granja donde se cultivan frutas, verduras y hortalizas y también tiene una actividad comercial, mediante la cual se dedica a la venta de calzado deportivo y ropa para caballeros, aprovechando que su cónyuge trabaja en un taller de confecciones, donde puede obtener mejores precios por los productos que elaboran en esa empresa, aunque también compra en centros comerciales especializados que le ofrecen buenos precios. Sus ventas las realiza a crédito  y planea ampliar el surtido de productos,  pues tiene una meta de crecimiento empresarial para poder adquirir su casa propia y este es un gran desafio, pues debe hacerlo poco a poco. Esta es la razón para que en la actualidad esté aplicando a un credikiva, con el cual comprará jeans, suéteres para caballeros y calzado deportivo, los cuales tiene encargado y forman parte de su estrategia para hacer crecer su mercado.
texts.en: Jaime is 42 years old and lives southwest of the city with his spouse and their 14 year old son. He works on a farm where he grows fruits, greens and vegetables. He also has a business selling athletic shoes and men’s clothing, taking advantage of his spouse’s work in a clothing factory where he obtains better prices for the products that they make. He also buys from specialized shopping centers that offer good prices. He sells on credit and plans to increase his stock because his goal is to grow his business so that he can purchase his own home. Since this is a huge challenge he must do it little by little. This is why he is currently applying for a Kiva loan with which he will buy jeans, men’s sweaters and athletic shoes, which he has ordered and is part of his strategy to grow his business.

loans.use: purchase jeans, men's sweaters and athletic shoes.

loans.name: Adriana Del Carmen

texts.es: Adriana de 40 años de edad vive en un sitio turístico, con su cónyuge y sus dos hijos en las edades de 17 y 19 años. Allí tiene un negocio mediante el cual vende cervezas, que inició hace nueve (9) años, cuando su cónyuge tenia su estadero en otro barrio, en el que en ese momento vivía; al mudarse   al sitio donde actualmente habita, ubicado  muy cerca a la ciénaga de Mallorquin, ecosistema de gran importancia para el desarrollo sostenible de la región, y sitio muy visitado por turistas, decidió empezar a vender cervezas en un Kiosco adquirido para ese fin, y  que poco a poco lo convirtió en un estadero,  con el genera ingresos adicionales que benefician a su familia. Adriana y su esposo cuentan con los enseres necesarios para el desarrollo de esta actividad,  tienen 50 sillas, un equipo de sonido de gran potencia o PICK-UP y 2 enfriadores donde almacena la bebida. Ella trabaja solo los fines de semana y es muy apoyada por su familia todos los sábados, domingos y festivos,  desde las 10 de la mañana hasta las 10 de la noche.  Su meta es diversificar su oferta agregando comidas, que es una de las necesidades que debe solucionar en sus clientes mas adelante. En la actualidad Adriana está aplicando a un credikiva, primer finaciamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario anto Domingo, con el cual comprará cervezas para provisionarse, pues la temporada de pre- carnaval y sus fiestas, hacen que aumente la demanda, que así mismo se intensifica durante los 4 días, en el que ocurre  una de las fiestas mas lindas del país : El carnaval de Barranquilla”  lleno de colorido, música tambores y diversidad de disfraces tradicionales, que emulan personajes del mundo, hechos ocurridos en el pasado y son la expresión sana del caracter alegre y cumbiambero, del pueblo caribe Colombiano, convirtiendose en un espectaculo para la gente de la Región y los visitantes de otros países y ciudades de Colombia, que llegan a la Barranquilla a disfrutarla .
texts.en:
Adriana is 40 years old. She lives with her husband and two children, ages 17 and 19, in a very popular tourist spot. There she has her own business selling beer. She began this business nine years ago when her family moved to its current location from another neighborhood. Now they live very close to the Mallorquín swamp, an ecosystem that is very important to the sustainable development of the region and highly visited by tourists. Adriana bought a kiosk and began to sell beer from there. Little by little, she has been converting the kiosk into an inn to generate more income for her family. 

Adriana and her husband rely on the equipment necessary to expand their business. They have 50 chairs, a PICK-UP or a very powerful sound system, and two coolers where they store drinks. Adriana works on holidays and weekends from 10 a.m. to 10 p.m. She feels very supported by her family. Her goal is to diversify her menu and add food items, which her clients look forward to in the future. 

Adriana is requesting this Kiva loan, which is her first loan with the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. She will use this loan to buy beer so she will be ready for the celebrations leading up to and during Carnival, when demand increases. During these four days the country's most incredible celebrations take place, including the colorful Carnival of Barranquilla, with much percussion music and a variety of traditional costumes from all over the world. Historical events are recreated and express the healthy, Caribbean, and joyful character of the Colombian village. It is a spectacular event for the region and many visitors from other countries and from all over Colombia come to enjoy it.

loans.use: to buy beer.

loans.name: Sagrado Corazón Group

texts.es: Doña Carolina es una mujer alegre trabajadora y emprendedora, ella tiene 43 años de edad, es originaria de una comunidad pintoresca llamada Curungueo, ella es parte de un grupo el cual se llama Sagrado Corazón ya que es el santo patrono de su comunidad y es por eso que le puso así al grupo. Ella tiene un negocio de abarrotes en un local que cerca de la carretera, dice  que puso ese negocio desde hace mas de 18 años y que lo puso en su comunidad por que antes no había una tienda bien surtida y para que la gente de su comunidad no gastara en pasajes para trasladarse a otra población ella abrió su abarrotera. En el mes de agosto ella se dedica hacer coronas para los muertos ya que es una tradición que en el mes de noviembre se les adorne las tumbas a los difuntos. Ella hace las coronas y unas las vende en su tienda de abarrotes y otras se las manda a su esposo quien tiene un vidriería en otra población llamada Zitacuaro. Ahorita ella está pidiendo un crédito para la compra de abarrotes como productos no perecederos como atún, sardina, chiles en vinagre, aceite para cocinar, arroz, azúcar, canela molida, maicena, sopas,  gelatinas, papel higiénico, lentejas, sazonadores de pollo etc. ya que quiere mejorar su abarrotera para que sus clientes no se vayan a otros lugares a comprar productos. Su meta es tener su propio local para ya no pagar más rentas. Las otras integrantes del grupo se llaman Laura, Yrene, María Cristina ellas invertirán su crédito en la compra de calzado de diferentes marcas para vender, para la compra de material para construcción para su venta y para surtir una tienda de abarrotes.
texts.en:
Carolina is a happy, hardworking, entrepreneur.  She is 43 years old.  She is originally from a picturesque community called Curungueo.  She is part of the Sacred Heart group, named after the patron saint of the community.  She has a grocery store in a place close to the road.  She started the business 18 years ago because her community at the time had no equivalently well stocked store.  She didn't want people to have to pay to travel to another location to shop.

In August, she makes wreaths for the dead as it is a tradition in November to decorate the graves of the dead.  She makes the wreaths and sells them in a grocery store and sends others to her husband who has a glassworks in the village of Zitacuaro.

Carolina is requesting a loan to purchase non-perishable groceries such as tuna, sardines, pickled chillies, cooking oil, rice, sugar, ground cinnamon, cornstarch, soups, jellies, toilet paper, lentils, poultry seasonings, etc.  She wants to improve the selection in her store so that her customers do not go elsewhere to shop.  Her goal is to own her own shop so that she no longer has to pay rent.  

The other group members include Laura, Yrene, and María Cristina.  They will use loan proceeds to buy different brands of shoes to sell, to purchase building materials for sale, and to stock a grocery store.

loans.use: to buy tuna, sardines, chili peppers in vinegar, cooking oil, rice, sugar, ground cinnamon, cornstarch, soups, jelly, toilet paper, lentils, chicken seasonings, etc., for a grocery store.

loans.name: Maria Dolores

texts.es:
María, tiene 49 años de edad, vive con su esposo, sus hijos están casados no viven con ellos, ella tiene cinco años de estar vendiendo ropa y fabrica manteles y cubrecamas, él negocio lo aprendió de sus padres que son comerciantes, de este negocio obtiene lo necesario para el hogar.
Solicita un préstamo para la compra de ropa para elaborar cubrecamas y manteles, adquiriendo retazos de tela de diferentes colores, entre otra mercadería, esta compra le ayudara para incrementar sus inventarios y sus ingresos.
La aspiración de María es fortalecer su negocio y brindarse una mejor calidad de vida con su esposo y tambien ayudar a su familia.
texts.en:
María is 49 years old. She lives with her husband; her children are married and no longer live with their parents. María has been selling clothing and making tablecloths and covers for five years. She learned this trade from her parents, who were also vendors. From this business, María is able to provide for her household. 

She is requesting a loan in order to buy different colored fabrics to make covers and tablecloths, clothing, as well as other merchandise for her business. This will help María to increase her inventory and her earnings. Her aspiration is to strengthen her business and to improve her quality of life, as well as help her family.

loans.use: to buy fabric for making covers and tablecloths.

loans.name: Sikata Group

texts.en:
Sikata Group is a group of 11 farmers in Bungoma South District, represented by Emily. The group has eight women and three men. Emily is on the right of the photo with her hand raised. 

Farming inputs will be delivered to her on credit consisting of the necessary materials to plant 0.5 acres of maize, millet, and sorghum. The 2013 Long Rains season will be Emily’s first season with One Acre Fund. She joined this year in order to grow enough food for the family and to access the best input prices.

Emily described her harvest last year as good, but hopes she can have an even better one as a One Acre Fund farmer. She plans on using future profits from the harvest to send her children to school and to repair her home. For the 2013 Long Rains season, Sikata Group members will take input loans of 0.5 acres each. In total, this group will receive input loans for use on 5.5 acres of land.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize, millet, and sorghum.

loans.name: Ana

texts.en: Ana is  taking out a loan of $600 to improve her business. She is running a kiosk that helps her to generate income for her family. She will use the loan to buy stock to keep in her store such as cigarettes, soft drinks (Coca-Cola, Sprite, Sagiko and Fanta), noodles, water, and biscuits. She opened her kiosk in 2005 with her own working capital of $50.00  She is a hard-working woman and she hopes to run a bigger business in the future.

loans.use: To buy Sprite, rice, fish, biscuits, Coca-Cola, Fanta, water, and noodles

loans.name: Luttomor

texts.en:
Mr. Luttomor is 55 years old and lives with his wife and son in a 'ger' in Bayanhoshuu district of Ulaanbaatar, Mongolia. His wife Shurentsetseg, age 54, works at a local market in housekeeping. His son Baasansuren, age 16, goes to local secondary school. 

This borrower has been running his taxi service in town since 2005. He has regular customers in the area and now he is planning to change his car into an eco-friendly electric and gas consuming car in order to increase its efficiency. He is now requesting 2,200,000 MNT to purchase an eco-friendly electric and gas consuming car for his taxi service business. He is well-experienced and a hardworking man.

loans.use: to purchase an eco-friendly electric and gas consuming car for his taxi service

loans.name: Joan

texts.fr: est une femme de 38 ans mariée mère de 8 enfants dont l'age varie entre 2 et 25 ans 5 d'entre eux vont à l'école. Elle est commerçante et fait la vente en détail et en gros des vivres frais (légumes) en fonction des saisons dans un marché de la place depuis 17 ans. Elle a une bonne connaissance des fournisseurs, et surtout de sa clientèle qu'elle a acquise au fil du temps grâce à son expérience dans ce domaine. Mais elle se retrouve constamment en rupture de stock parce qu'elle est obligée de faire écouler tous le stock pour pouvoir s'en procurer à nouveau ceci à cause de la petitesse de son capital. Elle souhaitera acheter les légumes en gros  pour avoir un bon stock ce qui permettra de mieux satisfaire la demande constante de sa clientèle et d'éviter les ruptures de stocks et d'augmenter ses bénéfices. Elle économisera son bénéfice pour non seulement agrandir son activité mais aussi subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.
texts.en: Joan is a 38-year-old married mother of 8.  Her children's ages vary between 2 and 25 years old, and 5 of them are in school.  She is a merchant and has sold retail and wholesale of fresh food (vegetables), seasonally in the same market place for the past 17 years.  She has a good relationship with suppliers, and most of all, customers that she has acquired over time with her experience in the market.  Still, she finds herself constantly out of stock because she has to sell out in order to buy more stock again, due to her limited capital.  She wants to buy vegetables in bulk to have enough stock to better meet the constant demand of her customers, to avoid stock shortages, and to increase her profits.  She will use her profits not only expand her business, but also to provide for her family.

loans.use: to buy wholesale vegetables

loans.name: Sandra Liliana

texts.es: Sandra de 43 años de edad es madre de 4 hijos en las edades de 8 a 16 años, ella con su experiencia de 18 años en el mantenimiento y venta de purificadores, hace 8 años logró emprender su propia aventura de negocios,  con el que hoy  genera  sus propios ingresos,  para sostener su hogar. Sus líneas de trabajo son  instalación y comercialización de todo lo relacionado con la purificación  de agua, actualmente es   proveedora de organizaciones importantes en  la hermosa capital de Colombia: “Bogotá”  Sus principales productos son filtros de neveras, purificadores de agua ozono, ultravioleta y carbón activado. En su meta de adquirir una casa trabaja persistentemente,  por eso requiere disminuir los precios de los productos, para ser más competitiva y abordar nuevos mercados, comprando en mayor volumen para obtener mejores descuentos y así mismo más utilidades. Esto es justamente un gran desafío, pues no cuenta con el suficiente capital de trabajo para lograrlo; es así como  acude a su primer credikiva, también primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el cual comprará en mayor volumen carbón activado, repuesto para ensamble y purificador. Sandra es muy disciplinada y planea ser más constante en organizar su contabilidad, para poder crecer aun mas y brindar a sus hijos mejores opciones de éxito..
texts.en:
Sandra is 43 years old and the mother of four children between the ages of 8 and 16. She has 18 years of experience working in the maintenance and sales of water filters. Eight years ago, Sandra opened her own business, from which she makes a living and supports her family. Now she works installing and selling everything related to water filters. Currently, she supplies many important organizations in Colombia's beautiful capital, Bogotá. 

Sandra's principle products include filters for freezers, ozone water filters, ultraviolet filters and activated carbon filters. She works persistently in order to reach her goal of acquiring a house. Sandra needs to reduce the prices of her products in order to be more competitive and enter new markets. She plans to buy supplies in larger quantities in order to get discounts and also have a better stock of products. This is quite a challenge for Sandra, since she does not have enough working capital yet. That is why she is requesting her first Kiva loan, which is also her first loan with the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. 

She will use this loan to buy activated carbon in larger quantities and spare parts to assemble purifiers. Sandra is very disciplined and she plans to stay organized in her accounting in order to be able to expand her business and offer her children better opportunities to succeed.

loans.use: to buy activated carbon in larger quantities and spare parts to assemble purifiers.

loans.name: Montserrat Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se llama “Montserrat” lo integran 19 emprendedores, sus principales negocios son venta de ropa y alimentos. Pertenecen a la ciudad de Puerto Montt, sur de Chile.
María Alejandra Paredes, en la foto la tercera de derecha a izquierda, viste chaqueta manga corta blanca con flores negras; desde hace 10 años que se dedica al rubro Pastelería; primero aprendió de su familia, posteriormente tomo cursos de repostería y banquetearía. Trabaja desde su casa y en ferias; da a conocer sus productos por afiches e internet.
Compra su mercadería en supermercados mayoristas. 
María Alejandra usó su crédito para abastecerse de ingredientes., tales como harina, huevos, azúcar, esencias, etc.
 Su sueño es ver crecer su negocio y tener una cafetería. 
Lo que más la motiva en seguir con su negocio, es que tiene la seguridad que contará con la ayuda de Fondo Esperanza ( créditos, asesoría)
Es casada, tiene una hija de 19 años quien estudia en la universidad.
Nos cuenta que lo que más le gusta de Fondo Esperanza es que hay un buen ambiente, cordialidad, buen trato y buenas relaciones.
Puerto Montt es una ciudad del sur de Chile, ubicada en la región de Los Lagos. Una de las atracciones de Puerto Montt son sus bellos paisajes verdes; sus playas poco frecuentadas; su gastronomía y especialmente la reputación de sus pescados y mariscos y sus artesanías. Es también la puerta de entrada a la Isla Grande de Chiloé, rica en tradiciones y leyendas.
texts.en:
This group, called “Montserrat”, is composed of 19 members whose principal businesses are selling clothing and food. They live in the city of Puerto Montt, in southern Chile.

Maria Alejandra, in the photo the 3rd from right to left, wearing the short-sleeved jacket with black flowers, has for the last 10 years made and sold pastries. First, she learned from her family, then took courses in baking pastries and banquet preparation. Maria Alejandrina works from home and in market fairs. She advertises her products by flyers and on the internet. She buys her ingredients in wholesale supply stores. Maria Alejandra will use her loan to purchase ingredients such as flour, eggs, sugar, flavorings, etc.

Her dream is to expand her business and to have a coffee shop. What motivates her to continue in business is to have security that she can count on, with the help of Fondo Esperanza through loans and advice. Maria Alejandra is married and has a 19-year-old daughter who studies in the university.

Maria tells us that what she likes most about Fondo Esperanza is its good ambients, cordiality, good treatment, and the good relations that exist there. 

Puerto Montt is a city in the south of Chile, located in region of Los Lagos. One of the attractions of Puerto Montt is its beautiful green landscapes, its little-frequented beaches, its gastronomy and especially its reputation for fish and seafood, and its artisan crafts. It is also the port of entry to the Isla Grande de Chiloe, rich in traditions and legends.

loans.use: buy merchandise and ingredients for making pastries.

loans.name: Umoja Group

texts.en:
Umoja Group, located in Bungoma South District, consists of nine women and one man and is led by Elizabeth, pictured on the right with her hand raised. A new One Acre Fund farmer excited for the 2013 Long Rains season, Elizabeth is receiving an input loan for ½ an acre of maize, millet and sorghum cultivation. She joined One Acre Fund in order to gain access to hybrid seed and fertilizer.

Elizabeth managed to harvest five bags of maize on 1/2 acre of land last year. As a One Acre Fund farmer, she hopes to harvest even more and plans on using future profits to send her children to school and perhaps invest in another business. For the 2013 Long Rains season, Elizabeth’s group members will take input loans for ½ an acre each. In total, this group will receive input loans for use on five acres of land.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize, millet, and sorghum.

loans.name: Saumu

texts.en:
Saumu, age 46, is married to Shee. She has seven children and lives in a neighborhood in the town of Mwambalazi, Kenya.

Saumu established her own business ten years ago. She sells cereals as retail from her home. Her business is located on the edge of the street, across from her house. In addition to this business, she also sells dumplings from her home. Both businesses are doing well.

She is asking for a loan from Yehu Microfinance Trust, so that she can buy more sacks of dry maize, rice, and beans. She will also buy wheat flour, cooking oil, and baking powder for making dumplings. She wants to maintain her inventory of products, so that she can increase her earnings.

loans.use: to buy more sacks of dry maize, rice, and beans and also ingredients to make dumplings.

loans.name: Uaminifu C Group

texts.en:
Lucy is pictured on the right with her hand raised amongst her Uaminifu C Group members. The ten of them, six women and four men, are farmers in Bungoma South District. Farming inputs consisting of the necessary materials to plant half an acre of maize,millet and sorghum will be delivered to her on credit . Lucy first enrolled with One Acre Fund during the 2012 Long Rains season and is now preparing to be a One Acre Fund farmer during the 2013 Long Rains season. Lucy joined One Acre Fund in order to access the best input prices and grow enough food for the family.

Prior to joining One Acre Fund, Lucy was only able to harvest four bags of maize per one half acre, but after joining One Acre Fund during the Long Rains 2012, she was able to harvest ten bags per one half acre. She hopes that her profits from the 2013 Long Rains season can be used to send her children to school and perhaps invest in another business. During the 2013 Long Rains season, each group member will receive half an acre of agricultural inputs on credit. Lucy’s group will receive five acres worth of inputs on credit.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize, millet, and sorghum.

loans.name: Swalehe

texts.en:
Swalehe is 33 years old and lives with his wife and two children in the town of Mwambalazi. He is very hard-working and is always setting a good example at home since every morning he wakes up with new dreams and desires for prospering. 

Swalehe currently has a small shop where he stocks and sells stationery, especially books. Thanks to God, he has a good customer base because customers like his way of being and of attending to them. He is very happy because every day he is doing well. 

For some time, Swalehe has wanted to expand his only source of work and to have the shop a little better stocked. For this reason, he decided to come to Yehu Microfinance Trust to apply for a loan. With it, he can stock up his shop by buying more books, to offer a variety to his customers. 

He is grateful to all the good-hearted people who want to help him and he promises to repay his loan punctually.

loans.use: to buy more books, to offer a variety to his customers.

loans.name: Ephraim

texts.en:
Ephraim, aged 56 years, acquired a loan amount of 800,000 UGX. He is married, and has ten children who are all in school.

Ephraim trades in goats in the nearby markets, working two days in a week and six hours in a day. He receives additional income as a catechist for the nearby church.

He started his business in 2003 in a rural area. He has been in a position to support his family by providing basic necessities and school fees for the children. He wants money to add to his business since he hopes to rear about 1,000 goats in order to yield a good income. His challenges include tropical diseases that attack the goats.

He is a hardworking and honest person who has been in position to pay his previous loans well. He hopes to expand his business through continued support from UGAFODE Microfinance Ltd.

loans.use: To buy goats

loans.name: Ndolekho Group

texts.en:
Isaac’s group has 10 farmers and is located in Bungoma South District. Isaac is pictured on the right of Ndolekho Group with his hand raised. Isaac is pictured amongst the three men and seven women of his group. He will receive input loans capable of planting half an acre with millet, sorghum and maize. The 2013 Long Rains season will be Isaac’s first season with One Acre Fund. He joined this year in order to access the best input prices and to improve his farming techniques with the One Acre Fund method.

Isaac managed to harvest six bags of maize on one half acre of land last year. As a One Acre Fund farmer, he hopes to harvest even more. He hopes that his profits from the 2013 Long Rains season can be used to send his children to school and save for the future. During the 2013 Long Rains season, each group member will receive half an acre of agricultural inputs on credit. Isaac’s group will receive five acres' worth of inputs on credit.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize, millet, and sorghum.

loans.name: Gjergji

texts.en:
Gjergji is 24 years old and single. He lives in Albania.  Gjergji was born with musical talents and developed the skills later on through the “school of music."  He plays saxophone and clarinet. At 18 when he finished his high school, he started playing musical instruments with a few orchestras in his region. A year later, he selected his own orchestra team.

Gjergji is requesting his second loan for 100,000 Albanian Lek, which he will use to buy a new clarinet since the old one has been damaged. His orchestra team has been invited to play in different activities.

loans.use: to purchase a new clarinet to use in his orchestra.

loans.name: Solomon

texts.en:
Solomon is a 35-year-old gentleman who is married to Ruth, a housewife. He is the father of four children, aged 12, 10, and 2 years, and 6 months old. He has been employed in a motorcycle transport business that earns him a monthly income of KES. 30,000. 

Solomon has applied for his first loan of KES. 78,504, which will help him purchase a new motorcycle. He hopes to buy a fleet of motorbikes and educate his children with the proceeds.

loans.use: to purchase a new motorcycle.

loans.name: Uaminifu A Group

texts.en:
Uaminifu A is a group of 10 farmers (9 women and 1 man) in Bungoma South District. Doreen is at the back right of the photo with her hand raised. Farming inputs will be delivered to her on credit consisting of the necessary materials to plant ½ an acre of maize, millet and sorghum. Doreen first enrolled with One Acre Fund during the 2011 Long Rains and is now preparing to be a One Acre Fund farmer during the 2013 Long Rains season. Doreen joined One Acre Fund in order to gain access to hybrid seed and fertilizer and to grow enough food for the family.

Doreen reports that before One Acre Fund, she was able to grow about 3 bags of maize per ½ acre, but with her One Acre Fund input loan during Long Rains 2012, she harvested 7 bags per ½ acre. She hopes that her profits from the 2013 Long Rains season can be used to repair her home and perhaps to invest in another business. Doreen’s group members will each receive input loans of ½ acre during the 2013 Long Rains season, for a total of 5 acres of maize and sorghum.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize, millet, and sorghum.

loans.name: Mwahanje

texts.en:
Mwahanje, 35 years old, lives with his wife and six children in the rural area of Mwambalazi. Over ten years ago, he decided to open a retail shop in his home. Thanks to effort and hard work, Mwahanje's business has expanded. He now has a steady clientele because of the good and friendly service he provides to his customers.
